OlCYOJJ6ZvxaDTxuAaH-pA.text: Had been eager to give this place a try and now I regret even stepping a foot in the door. Service was elementary at best but the food was absolutely horrible.   Appearance wise, food got an A+ but once we took a bite it was very disappointing. My wife had a patty melt which had no flavor while I had a Philly cheese steak that had everything but the steak. The bread fell apart as soon as I picked it up and lacked flavor as well. We were really eager to try this place out but ended up disappointed. Sorry but ain't coming back

R6s7-3vE-yQkz65x2aDeSA.text: Yum, yum, yummy!  I'm in love with Great Links!  We finally made it over to Great Links this weekend and I am kicking myself for making it out here sooner!  I have wasted many, many years of AMAZING edible delights by not coming to Great Links earlier.  At least I have seen the light and the error of my ways!  We sampled the Streets of New York Dog (yum), the Ball Park Dog (classic), and a kraut dog (tasty), as well as the uber-fantastic Italian tater tots.  The dogs were all amazing!  The have a great snap when you bite in to them, which is always a sign of a quality dog.  The toppings were all on point and in a decent amount for the dogs we ordered.  I think the kraut here is some of the best I have ever had.  EVER.    Now on to the the most fabulous tater tots I have ever had the pleasure of eating.  We tried the Italian tater tots on our server's recommendation.  We were going to do fries, but her told us the tater tots would stand up better to all of the sauce, so we went with it.  Oh my goodness, those things were tasty!  The garlic goodness was great and the Parmesan on top sent it over the moon.  We had them finished before I had finished my hot dog, so I used some of my bun to soak up the extra sauce and it was stay fantastic.  Yummmm!  I can't wait to go back and try more dogs, sausages, burgers, and everything else they had on the huge menu.  I see this place becoming a very regular place for my family.

B-1LilNQfcIBrVXGCKwBSA.text: The best everything we try we love always fresh and hot when we order pick up it still steaming when we get home got to try this place !!!!!!!

wW3UbCz5dMQe85T-NqMc4w.text: Me and my girlfriend were in the other side of town the other day and decided to try something different. The ambiance was pretty casual and everybody seemed really nice. I ordered a Bacon burger and a chili cheese dog, and my girlfriend just ordered a chili cheese dog.  The food was really mediocre considering it was $6.50 for a burger and $5 for a hot dog. If we were a couple of dollars cheaper I probably would have been okay with it.   The reason I'm giving it 3 stars because I cook behind the counter never changed his gloves and was wiping his face with sweat the whole time. Luckily the meal tasted good.   Not sure if I'm coming back due to the fact that the prices were pretty high for just a burger and hotdog. And if that guy keeps working here I will not be coming back because that place looks very unsanitary due to no changing of any gloves.

photos.caption: Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili cheese dog with bacon, &amp; a bacon cheeseburger.

XOqSaS2sjT9BEeqL-m7q5A.text: Mid 2016 we came and had a a horrible experience. We were driving by and thought "what the heck, let's give it another try..." and boy are we glad we did! The food was amazing! The service was a MILLION times better and we really had a good experience. Food itself isn't always the make and break of a restaurant, most of the time it's the service and the people. From the cook to the waiter - they were all really nice! They also kept asking if we needed refills which is always awesome because my husband goes through like 10 drinks in one sitting. A complete 180 from our last experience there last year. We will DEFINITELY be coming back asap! Try the Wally Dog and the Beer Brat with sauerkraut. They're awesome! And Definitely try the crinkle cut Italian Fries but ADD buffalo sauce. They're amazing! Two thumbs up!

nPtHT0RzdneqHghC8RTzmQ.text: OMG! This place rocks, food is fantastic and the staff are cool as hell! Carissa is the bomb made this experience totally enjoyable! Best fried pickles I've had in years! Overall experience 10+ You gotta try this spot and they serve beer bonus!

pRJzm5cyQ_ItpglHTiDRNw.text: Came here a long while back and gave the hot dogs a go (which were GOOD)...now I had a chance to try the burger!  Pastrami Cheeseburger ($8.29): 1/3lb, Pastrami, Provolone Cheese, Grilled Onions, and Spicy Mustard. Very good burger...very juicy and love the MELTED cheese! Lots of flavor in their pastrami as well...GREAT choice!  Also tried the Italian Beef Sandwich ($7.99): Simmered in Italian spiced Au Jus with Green Peppers. Not a huge fan of Italian beef sandwiches, but this was good overall.  And the fries :  Vegas Chili Cheese Fries ($6.59): Sage Sausage White Chili, Pepper Jack Cheese, Tomatoes, Cayenne Sour Cream, and Spicy Mustard. This was great, with lots of spices in the sausage/chili and sauces. A bit HEAVY on the mustard, but still enjoyable.  PORTION was too big, so I took the rest to work with me, and somehow they still tasted good HOURS later...what the??  Italian Fries ($3.99): Garlic Butter Sauce, Italian Seasonings, and Parmesan Cheese. These were very good! LOTS of garlic flavor...yum!  I had these last time I was here and knew we were gonna order them again this time!  I'd recommend these most outta the bunch :P  Service is fast and friendly here.  I need to stop in more often :)  Pics :

bcX8ccQrwEaC9PIwpqNXxw.text: So we decided to give this place a try knowing that it has some previous complaints on service.....well same old story and same old song and dance.  Very poor service, Greasy Fries and a tit-for-tat brouhaha between the server and the cook resulted in a 1.5 Hour wait and no food to boot. Lame service and the cook and server need to go. The owner came out and tried to apologize but the damage has been done. He should have offer a free meal for the 4 of us but he didn't go that extra mile so I'm posting what I think of this place.  What restaurant serves the side (fries and ring) before the Burger come out? That was our first clue Sherlock, and then the marathon wait begins.......................Nothing! So we left and went to Farmers Boys and got our meal in a reasonable time, Really FB beat you losers out?  greasy fries and very slow service. never again.......

However, do have a pretty decent selection of beer, considering the dive type burger/hot dog shop.  Either way I highly recommend this spot for a great bite to eat!

PA4nZPhhi4QdaSPUHWb31g.text: We had an excellent meal in this unassuming restaurant. What drew is here was the fact that they have vegetarian substitutes for every menu item, so both my husband and I can eat off the menu. I had the vegetarian slaw dog with chili. It was delicious! My husband had the Chicago dog which he enjoyed. We shared the Italian fries which we agreed would be a reason alone to return! The service was quick and friendly. We'll be back for sure!

YbcjYasO2P4X7g3X5QjFtw.text: Are you in the mood for some hot dogs or some other American diner food? Do you want to watch TV while you dine? Then Great Links is the place.  Firstly this particular Great Links is not that big so it can fill up pretty fast. I like how you can sit on the bar stools and watch them prep your meal. Everyone is friendly that works here. They have some TVs up showing sports stuff. Today was nascar and they even were having some specials in celebration.  Now for what really matter the food! I try to stop by great links every time I drive by. Go for their hot dogs or sausages. My brother usually gets the burgers. Today I went for a Reuben and it was tasty! I love the rye bread they use and the cheese melted perfectly on the corned beef. As a side I got the natural cut fries. I just love the darkness of their fries. And if you want you can get shoestring or tater tots. The root beer they have is good! They serve beer as well I believe.  I give 4 stars for Great Links classic American food and great service!

c_lUlxPNct6EUwwkiAPWMA.text: So as many of my yelpers know I'm a very dedicated foodie and today I stumbled upon the holy grail a place that took me back to the streets in New York while actually in Vegas. First of all I see a lot of good service in Vegas tend to be products of people from different places just being themselves but if you want the best service hands down you're gonna come to Great Links its the family you never knew you had. I promise you with Lisa on you'll never have an empty drink she's gonna come and make sure everything is 5 star and she's gonna laugh and have fun with you. But the king of the crop Mike the head cook. the grill master, the guy you want to cook at every barbecue you have for the rest of your life will find away to make the best of the best of whatever you want while many Maintaining great conversation. I know this will be a new weekly spot and its one of the only places we you can come and watch the news and have really educated conversation. All in all this is the best place in Vegas and all of everyone I know should come in

ntZcdSVnOh70xIocSRKZ_A.text: My man likes the burgers and dogs here. I am not 100% sold. I ordered the Italian Beef and if you are from Chicago, or have enjoyed a really decent beef sandwich in Chicago, This beef sandwich was a huge disappointment. So next time I will stick with a burger or dog.

rxDzdqdbCI-_eYMhy76prg.text: AWESOME-SAUCE!!!! This was our first time here, so Charlie had us sit at the bar & briefly covered the whole menu for us & provided us w/ some info abut the place. He was SO nice!  Hubby tried the chili dog & I had the Chicago dog (minus the sport peppers). They were DELICIOUS! i'm not a chili fan because I don't really care for beans. Well thiers was pork & didn't have any beans, so it was sooooo good!! Also, I didn't know what sport peppers were & another guy working the grill turned around & handed us a small cup of them to try! ALL the employees there take care of you!!! Oh, thier fry sauce was awesome, too! Will definitely be back! I_0rklBwQsysXQHnTkFA1w.text: Ordered two BLT sandwiches. When I go the sandwich I could not tell until I smelled it. The tomatoes were very rotten, they smelled of strong urine and had white on them. Food Quality control is not good, I will not be going back to this resturant.

BEXQVgWU3SBY-GxXqyLBLQ.text: Was really excited about going here. It's close by to our house and we enjoy hot dogs. We went in and it took the cashier a couple minutes to come over and just ask us if we where ready. She seemed annoyed. We told her it was our first time and we'd like to look over the menu first. When we where ready she took our order, Chicago dog, Louisiana link, cheese fries and house salad. $20 for it all. Seemed pricey for me. We where asked if we wanted to eat here. We really would have loved to. But it was overwhelmingly hot in there. It felt like a sauna. I know today was probably the hottest days in Vegas, (114 on 6/7/13) but when you want to be inside on a summer day, outside shouldn't be hotter. We took our food home. The Chicago dog tasted good, it was soggy, like all the juice from the toppings where Just added to it. The hot dog tasted good, them seem to have a good product, only problem was, the restaurant was hotter than my dog. The Louisiana link was good. Spicy! No complains there. The cheese fries, I would suggest not getting. They where soggy. It almost seemed like cheap frozen fries from the grocery store, microwaved and drowned with cheese. We where only able to eat half because the other half wasn't even removable from the paper wrap in the container. Salad, I couldn't tell you because the didn't include our dressing. And after our experience, didn't really feel like going back. I don't know if we would have received better food if we ate in or not. We weren't too pleased. Won't be goon back. We'd rather go to weinersnitchel. They seem to have a good thing going on. I'll just be weary if you go in.

ycvd2GpjuqJCcgzOnJ3vwA.text: i ordered the chicken Caesar salad sandwich when i went and it was stellar. i will be back again and again !!! they have such a huge selection of stuff i don't know how anyone wouldn't be able to find something delicious on the menu!

UgHT8mRd8jhMOSTvaw_gqQ.text: Was all the way on the Northwest side of town to go play a poker game at my brother's, and somehow my friend and I ended up at Great Links.  Let's face it, Chili dogs, burgers and fries just go together with a night of drinking and poker.  I wasn't about to offer Sweet Tomatoes express as a suggestion for our pre-game snack.  Right when I walked in I noticed a big board on the counter detailing their win as the Best Burger in Las Vegas.  I remember seeing some stuff about this contest on Fox 5 and John Curtas was one of the guest judges, so I figured it had some clout behind it.  I asked the waitress about it because I wanted to order the EXACT burger that won, and she was actually very upfront about how the contest was set up, and that it did have exclusions (I don't believe my current favorite Bachi was able to be represented due to cost, same with Burger Bar)   Hmmmm, doubt already started setting in.   Turns out the burger that won that contest was the Jalapeno Guacamole burger, which turned out to be the one that I was most interested in anyhow, bonus!  Cayenne Mayo, Tomato, Grilled onions and jalapenos, pepperjack cheese, and an onion ring filled with guac.  Yeah, sign me up!     My friend and I decided to share a side, and while I pushed for one of the actual french fry concoctions, he asked if I wanted to share the Frito Pie.  Uh, I guess.  When the food arrived (after a few beers, naturally), the burger looked impressive.  I'm all about saving the best for last though so I tackled the Frito Pie first.  Eh, tasted just like Frito Pie.  I guess I shouldn't knock it since it tasted exactly what a Frito Pie should taste like, but I was hoping for a bit of ingenuity or something that might set it apart.  After cursing my friend for twisting my arm into ordering that and not one of their fry options, I bit into the burger.  I got exactly what I expected and wanted out of it:  greasy, flavorful, and messy.  I felt like a star of a Carl's Jr commercial, except not nearly as hot.  I had also ordered the 1/2 lb version instead of 1/3, and that wasnt necessary even though I ate the entire thing.  So all in all, the burger was very tasty, even though I still prefer places like Bachi, Fuku, and maybe even In N Out.  I wouldn't recommend the Frito Pie and would imagine their fries are probably pretty damn tasty (shakes fist at friend).   The service was friendly and prices were very reasonable which bumps my total score from a mid 3 to a 4.

oa6adoEdgqz3iKIGHhN25A.text: OMG!!! i loved it. I had the Las Vegas Dog my GF had the Mob Boss Dogg and we SMASHED!!! its a nice cozy spot perfect for watching a game eating great food and grabbing a beer. 3 thumbs up if i had another. lol

O6kPSN44pprvYbjIPMH65Q.text: Simply less than mediocre.  If your thinking about going, do yourself a favor and don't.  You don't have to be a 5 star chef to put some semi creative toppings on a freaking hot dog.  The only reason I didn't leave pissed off as apposed to mildly disappointed was because the prices were cheap.  Maybe it was my fault for expecting so much for such a low price, I should have remembered the age old saying,"you get what you pay for".  But seriously people if you are craving a good hot dog either go to Pinks, or go to the store buy $10 worth of ingredients and get down with some good eats at home.  The End!

jgDbjQKuGjJpsQwYr7FNnA.text: This is my 1st and last time coming here, I order fries and the beef Louisiana hot link which were have been good had I not clearly seen the employees in the kitchen. I have been in foodservice for about 10 years now. The kid working in the kitchen has on the same gloves since I walked in. He has touched every pieces of equipment and peoples food with the same nasty grease gloves, I watched him put his hand in the bag of fries, he pulled meat from the freezer with the same gloves at this moment I am watching as he touches the computer and now handling more food. This place is a health case waiting to happen. Retrain the employees and treat them the proper use of gloves. Just because you wear gloves doesn't mean you cant wash your hands, doesn't mean you can walk around a contaminated the restaurant and put in danger of food poisoning. Please make the employees aware of their hygiene in food service.

b_fU_IYAs3LWsMrDP-zXLg.text: They have a delicious Louisiana Hot Link. But alas, nobody would come to the counter. Just walked back and forth and never even acknowledged me. Guess I will just have to cook my own at home fro now on.

6dX_euE85TxBZmZ9RHzDgg.text: Extremely friendly staff with great food options. The Chicago dog was on point and the Las Vegas dog was a tasty twist on the chili dog. They serve Big Dog Root Beer which I highly recommend.

brtORyL3vj_l7ctnfOSX8A.text: After craving a hotdog, I pulled out the technological equivalent of a crystal ball that is the yelp app.  GLB&G seemed the place to visit for lunch during the work week based on the reviews.  Easily located using the technological divining rod that is the yelp app, the team rolled in after the 11:00 hour.  Parking was a breeze as was the seating despite the potential for tight quarters during a rush.  The menu boasts over 152 hot dog and sausage combinations.  Again, according to the menu, their hot dogs are custom made by Boar's Head.  Your gonna get 7 1/2 inches of natural cased beef and pork.  I set my sights on the Deluxe Chili Cheese Dog w/ chili on the side.  The contents included cheddar cheese, bacon, onions and jalapenos.  What really got the party started was the portion of the menu containing the specialty fries!  Once again, the menu states there are over forty different combinations to customize your order.  We decided to order three off the menu with only a few minor tweeks at the recommendation of our on point and truly wonderful server, Michelle.  They included the following:  Italian Fries- With Italian seasoning, parmesan cheese and a tasty garlic butter sauce on top of recommended crinkle cuts fries.  Next up was the Buffalo Cheesy Fries- Recommended tater tots tossed in a mild buffalo sauce, and topped with melted cheese. Grill Master Fries- Recommended shoestring fries smothered in cheese, grilled onions, and thousand island dressing.  As the baskets of addictive potato masterpieces came out to the table, and they allicited multiple OMG responses.  Their beauty was only matched by their taste as they dropped on my tie and on my lap of which I did not care... I was in a high starch and fat high.  Once I came to, my boss was kind enough to offer their water so I could spot clean.  My dog was good but nothing compared to fries which could have easily been meal onto it's self.  All this goodness was washed down with a 22 ounces glass of Death Vally Root Beer.  They also serve beer.  Next to the root beer a cold glass of golden nectar would be an amazing means to compliment the meal!  I look forward to retuning in the very near future and experiencing the happiness that is GLB&G!

hpfUO-YlaPCrsem5twlCBw.text: The inside of the bar was really special and it carried a nice atmosphere. However, the food was "typical bar food" now this may sound terrible but if you are looking for 5 star atmosphere this is the place but if you are expecting Red Robin type food this is why the 3 star rating  Broaden you menu guys you have the makings of a downtown Summerlin competitor

f8WlpXEF3OCewKCU2LuMqA.text: I had a burger that was good, nothing life changing. Wife had fish and chips that were pretty good. They came directly out of the deep fryer piping hot. Fry sauce is delicious. Staff is really nice. Large menu to choose from. Will be back to try more item.

1NsttqGotqZfCEqNrH4chA.text: I love this place. The staff is always super friendly. I haven't ordered anything I haven't liked yet. I wish they would open another location closer to my house.

rnyKoE7pmgnPG5JR1---9g.text: Awesome service and food every single visit we have eaten here. No better place to grab a hotdog or burger with your family in the North, northwest and their jalapeno poppers are everything.

d3FlZjj8o17v7Q7DGxGB4Q.text: Service is slow, orders are incorrect, food is subpar. Expect a soggy hot dog bun.

fMT7kZ7BB2m3t9PWJx2OAw.text: I am updating my review to post by far the WORST fucking customer service I have ever experienced. Which is extremely upsetting and disappointing considering I am a frequent patron of this place. The ONE time I call to advise of an issue I get an asinine excuse for customer service.   I placed a multiple order pickup for my office and went to pick up on my lunch. I drove there paid then got back to work. Opened the boxes to find a sandwich was missing and received an extra order of fries. I called to advise and was at first gonna ask to pickup the sandwich but was immediately shot down and was basically called a liar. I was completely stumped as all the food went to one place and looking right at it and told him it wasn't in the bag. This "manager",Julian, kept arguing and refused to meet me half way of either refunding only the sandwich or make another for me to pick up. His excuse? They've been gypped before so. . . Ha, wow! He wanted me to bring the entire order back to "prove" I didn't get the item. Seriously? For one fucking sandwich? I seriously can't believe this place will treat a regular with such little respect. I get it - you want to believe you do everything right all the time - but we are all humans and prone to error. This one time shows me where they hold their customer base. Hold on tight to that $9 - you're losing much more than that with this experience.   Like I said, it's shocking and extremely disappointing because when I typically go - I eat in with no error. I go once during the lunch rush and complain ONCE and get treated like some hooligan trying to rob the place. I will NEVER return and trust that I will spread the word of how fucking awful you treat your patrons. Food is good but not worth it in case you find an error that they refuse to take ownership for.

CkGrJYRWa7rC4Ml7fNSVaw.text: We love this place! It has a huge menu. We go here about twice a month. They have great side. Also lots of different dogs and burgers. I don't know how the waitresses keep up but I always feel taken care of.

rGBEF5AVq57EwzLLQ8BDGw.text: It had been over 18 months since my last visit here, and, based on my most recent experience, I'm pleased to restore a 5th star!  Cheese Fries that were smothered with mellow Cheese Sauce was a yummy side.  A Boar's Head Kraut Dog smeared with Heinz Yellow Mustard and ensconced in a blanket of Sauerkraut was suitably hot, and each bite yielded a very nice, audible snap.  A fully dipped grilled Italian Beef Sandwich with grilled Green Peppers tasted very good, but I liked it better with some ketchup.  Service at the counter was very good and friendly in a casual atmosphere.  Great Links is a fine haven for topnotch comfort food!

XzP_xZA3OlxEYfsBHymixA.text: Not one of the best hot links I have had. A lot closer to the worst. Sat at the counter and watched the cook do his thing and the things he did were not what I would considered the best practices for a good hot dog. What would the technique matter as long as the result was tasty. While I was watching the cook I had memories of Chef Randy and Robert Irvine going into a restaurant and chastising cooks for not having a clean grill and covering everything with a pan when it was cooking. Mind you as long as the end result was a culinary masterpiece I am a big fan of a good, tasty sandwich I was open and excited looking forward to tasting a fantastic dog  on a toasted bun with raw onions, relish, and brown and yellow mustard. A basic sandwich hard to do wrong. But the end result was so wrong. The taste of the meat and bun was lost somewhere between the cooked onions, peppers, burgers and whatever else was cooked on the grill.  The place had a good sized crowd was real busy and the people seemed to be enjoying the food. But this is one customer that will not be  regular or even occasional patron.

svlp60T0AKWTFoxQjYn2_w.text: I had the grilled Ortega pepper bacon cheeseburger. It was delicious. Perfectly cooked and well seasoned. The service was friendly and prompt. I will return.

YGzlg5On57WOoFcXhznghQ.text: Raise the prices and they lower the quality. They now no longer use Boars Head products. Their current products worse I ever tasted. Service was always slow and that day was no exception. With tip it cost $30 for two people for hot dogs,fries, and drinks. My advice stay at home and eat Oscar Meyer it will taste better.

EH-vShbOW1pf0SAA-Q6WAg.text: Alright so I've been here quite a few times and so far I think to stick with the hot dog, links/sausages offerings and sides. After delving off menu a few times, I think it's the most solid they have to offer.   My  favorites out of the hot dog is the Las Vegas chili dog or chicago dogs. I also often get the sausages, mostly hot links. Hot dogs are Boars head so they have natural casings or you can get other types without the snap, even a white hot dog/veal one. Sides wise their fried green beans with wasabi mayo is really good. To drink get Sprechers root beer off the tap! Also their raspberry ice tea isn't that regular Lipton soda fountain stuff, it's brewed so that is good too.   Stick with that and I think you'll have a good dinner here. Cheap, good American type food.  Seeing as they won some "best of" burgers,  thought their burgers would be fantastic, but it isn't any different from any old greasy spoon. Also fish type stuff, is pre battered so not anything you can't do at home with some Gordon's. I feel like some stuff is offered, just to offer it. I thought the turkey burgers, grilled chicken sandwiches and tuna melt were decent though.   My one thing about this place is that do not come at peak hours. I don't know if the owner is too cheap to hire another person but they really need more than one waitress, there's never been two waitresses I've ever seen. We went recently where it hit max capacity in this small place and she was in the weeds the whole time. It was hard to flag her down for some extra sauce, I had to wait a long time by the cash register, I just got up to serve ourselves some drinks (good thing I did not get raspberry tea that was behind the register). She already is running around like mad even when it's not a full house so they really need two people at least during the rush. It's not fair to the poor gal or to customers. I know it's not her fault, but some people were upset...and it sucks if she gets crapped on for something she cannot control at all. I'm going to stick with going only in the odd hours. I don't like going to a place and get no service.   Overall though, I like this place.

Q8SqF2cq9o36HMwSV9WYVQ.text: 5 stars off the bat!  Wanna know why?  Because the food is great and the service is greater!  I ordered the Mob Boss, and I shared the Vegas Chili Cheese Fries with my gf.  The Mob Boss had grilled onions, mushrooms, bell peppers, with marinara sauce and 2 mozzarella sticks on top with parmesan cheese to top it off, and of course the dog, it snapped every single bite I took. Fresh natural casing! Mmm!  And the Vegas Chili Cheese Fries were unique, it wasn't your average ground beef, onions, and beans chili, it tasted like broken down Italian sausage in it.  I didn't need ketchup or any other condiments with it because everything was THAT good!  The dine-in setting was a little small, but I had no problem with it, they had sports playing on the TV's and they also have bar seating!  Servers were cool and they made sure everything was OK with us.  I'm glad I finally tried this place out after driving by it how many times now.  I'm definitely gonna be a regular here knowing it's close to my house! ;)

LJYIA9YlZgI-6P998lVrNw.text: I've had the pleasure of eating here on just a few occasions and although I have a very limited diet they always know how to spice up my regular routine. Fantastic food and service was pretty good. Will surely come again and again..

FkhocVCW3_xd4tHNueU9QA.text: Service= top notch Food= super Price= excellent My husband and I live very close to Great Links and often stop in for a quick dinner when we are busy.  The little eatery is located in the Lowes parking lot so we often eat here midway through some home improvement project. The wait staff is so friendly and helpful, offering suggestions when asked. The food is delicious.  We love their cottage fries and I always ask for them extra crisp. My husband prefers his a little underdone and the cook always obliges both of us.  We mostly go for the dogs, which are loaded with different toppings per your selection.  My husband loves the  Las Vegas Chili Dog which is loaded with chili.  I am a Chicago dog fan and almost always go for the Chicago style dog.  Last night I opted for an Oretga chili bacon burger and was not disappointed. the burger had a lot of bacon on it.  Typically when I am out and order a bacon burger it comes a slice or maybe two of thin cut bacon.  Great Links' burger had a bacon weave if you will covering the top of my burger.   My daughter ordered chicken fingers and they were perfectly fried- crispy outside, juicy inside. The staff is so friendly and they are proud of what they have to offer.  We enjoy the home town feeling of the place All in all we love it.  We can grab dinner locally and go home full, all for under 20 dollars.

45DaWmoxRoKWss8NrcyuWw.text: This is a great little spot. I have been going to for years. Another little mom and pop spot, and those are my favorite.  They have a great variety of dogs, burgers, sandwiches, and appetizers to choose from. Although I haven;t tried it all (gimmie some time) everything I have tried has been great. When you're all done get a shake or a float to top it off..hell ya.  This is a small place so word of advice if you go during peak times, plan for a wait or you can also order and eat in the patio that sits a couple of stores down.

IuLVer3z2Q-pdDTMi8k5tA.text: Wow, so glad we decided to drop in here!  Casual atmosphere, the servers were all super friendly, not pushy, and they make recommendations if you need one!  The food was really good.  We had a pastrami sandwich and an Italian beef sandwich and split them.  We also had the Vegas chili cheese fries and onion rings (it was a cheat day, no calorie counting!).  The Italian beef was ok (I really like the one from Rosati's on Losee), the pastrami really hit the spot and the Vegas chili is so yummy!!!  It was almost a fast-food/sports bar environment; there were a few TVs in case you don't care for your dining partner's conversation but it was kid-friendly.  I think they do serve beer if you're dining in.    Also, they offer a military discount.  Get out there and support this business!

ku_6uRHP2iYUL68_C8kB3w.text: How have I not been here before?!   So good!!!  Had the fried mozzerella and I swear it was the best ever.  I know that is hard to screw up but it came out so damn perfect I was in heaven. Pastrami cheeseburger was even better! Friendly efficient service and good prices. This place is pure awesome!

cAu6c2kdAP7ToOPrWwiQLg.text: Omg there so good and awsome I feel in love with this place service is awsome I got full with 1 hot dog good portions ..

sqvwmgoi6pnAuN3JRljsdg.text: great place. Hot line, bar & tables. Smells great inside. Different types of beers offered, some on tap. Root beer on tap, big menu, vegan & gluten free friendly if that's your thing. Food tastes great. Seriously, if you have a problem with this place - you have problems.

5Yj1gz8D0DMs5O-s1Ir6oQ.text: The Skinny: large selection of menu items, reasonable prices, phenom artisan root beer (4) service: efficient, friendly (4) value: pretty reasonable considering the quality (4).  We were scouring around town to find a great place for hot dogs and so far fell short... until Great Links.  The first time we ate here, we were literally overwhelmed by the selection here. I mean in addition to hot dogs, you have burgers, sammys, a selection various fried items smothered with a different toppings and salads. And for you vegetarians out there, they have a mighty fine selection of veggie kielbasa, bratwurst, italian sausage, hamburgers. I've never heard of veggie kielbasa, but I thought that was a pretty brilliant thing.  Personally, being of the meat eating persuasion, I ordered myself a grilled chicken salad. Yeah boring I know. But honestly, my company was instituting this whole exercise/eat right initiative and I felt obligated to participate. (I have since fallen off the bandwagon.) Really at a place like this, I wasn't really expecting much because it is a burger/hot dog joint after all. I was surprised though. Although it's romaine, it's clearly freshly chopped (note, none of that early brownish tinge you get when it's been cut a long time ago) with other veggies.They have a very simple oil and vinegar dressing that hit the spot. Plus, the chicken was plentiful and moist. For less than $7, it's far superior to many grilled chicken salad in the same price range.  The hubs couldn't help but try their artisan root beer. For us soda drinkers, it's got that real root beer-ish, herbacious flavouring (in an absolutely good way) that brought us back to the good ol' days. A must try!  Not being on a company diet, the hubs has had the rueben, their KC Masterpiece Nascar special featuring Boarshead sausage, their italian sausage and side orders of their fried zucchini, regular shoestring fries and freshly cut french fries. Their reuben was pretty great while the KC Masterpiece Nascar special was a little overwhelming with all the cheese, BBQ sauce on it - it kind of detracted from the flavours of the sausage. Regardless, their plainer renditions fare better - the casings got a nice snap to it.  The sides were a hit or miss. The fried zucchini's batter was a little too heavy and fell apart when you picked it up. Their fresh cut fries don't have quite the crispiness that I look for in a french fry. I prefer their shoestring fries which were much crispier and lighter -- FYI - their shoesting is more the size of your standard McDonald's french fries.   Overall, given the price, I would definitely recommend this place for a good tuck in of hot dogs and root beer (4).

j1DQj6DJiD4CRKftJoOPew.text: This place rocks!  It's a burger and hot dog joint with tons of options. The service is always stellar and the food is delicious! They also have so many vegan and vegetarian options. The Italian fries are so good!

kph7Txpv1mbObgW93Mebfg.text: Arrive at 7:00p, get greeted 10 minutes after and server apologizes for wait.... Said he will be back with us shortly 8 minutes pass and he finally gets out order. Made to order so it's fresh.  Hot dog and Philly cheesesteaks were pretty good.  Would come back and try again because customer service was so good.

9XSTDrlw1a7Yh2yg3LR9_A.text: Love love love how they have vegetarian options for just about everything on the menu! Not to mention great tasting vegetarian options, to those familiar(or not) meat substitutes can be questionable. And the service and vibe in there has to be the reason we are always in there. They're so friendly and treat you like one of their friends or family!

E9G4SgvLq-A0-ude-hKM2A.text: This place is right by my house, I'm so lucky because I love it!  My favorite is the coney dog with mustard and onions... The cooks are nice and friendly and everything is cooked right in front of you.  The atmosphere is cozy, comfortable and clean.  I will go back again and again.  Thank you!

4Gk9xeD2_wKXNzfTgJqvxQ.text: I just can't find it in me to give five stars to a hot dog joint, but there is none better.  The atmosphere is perfect and the staff are super friendly.  They make a great shake.  There is such a great variety of burgers, dogs and sides you could try something different every time you go.  I've been here a half dozen times and it never let's me down.

kIm3Sh8SzflckBePaMq9Mg.text: Ok, I've seriously died and went to Artery Clogging Heaven!  This place is Awesome!  Among other things, I really enjoy Burgers & Hot Dogs....and this place has plenty of it!  There were so many things on the menu, I didn't know where to start.....  So, I went with a Pastrami Cheeseburger (Pastrami, Grilled Onions, Provolone, & Mustard on a Burger)....and a Regular Hot Dog.  Since I was dining solo, I sat at the counter behind the Grill.  I waited patiently and watched the short order cook prepare the artery choking goodness for all the patrons and myself.....that was fun.  After about 10 minutes my order was up.  I went after the Pastrami Cheeseburger first.....wow, it was tasty.  I liked the proportion of Pastrami to Cheeseburger.....some places put too much Pastrami and it overwhelms the burger....not here.  I also liked how well the Grilled Onions tasted.....they were chopped in med sized pieces which I prefer to the larger sized ones you find in some places.  It was so good, I didn't add anything to it....I ate it as it was served.  Next, I added some Mustard to the Regular Dog and bit into it.  I felt a familiar ~Snap~ as I took that first bite.....awesome!  You don't find too many snapper dogs around town, so I was pleased that I did.  Every bite was full of Hot Dog goodness.  There are so many varieties of Dogs & Burgers here, not to mention side dishes that I want to try.  Will I return?  I guarantee you I'll be back at least 10 times to try other stuff on the menu.

IGH3nBZ0MOaen-t48pDyGQ.text: As a kid growing up in home were mom didn't work, we rarely ate hot dogs. She always cook for us. When we did picnic's at the lake, or camping which we did a lot in the summer months, we'd eat hot dogs roasted over an open flame. Chili cheese dogs came later, and I didn't get to experience gourmet dogs until my adult years.   Today we tried Great Links, and I was surprised at the different variations of hot dogs. If you want new experience try this place. I had the  Chicago dog with fried zucchini sticks. My husband ordered the chili cheese fries with the New York hot dog.   The bun became soggy with the liquid from the relish? And when I went to pick mine up, it kinda fell apart in my hand, and with each bite, the toppings fell off and the hot dog came through the bottom of the bun. We watched the guy make them, so we know they were not sitting for a while, but still yet, who likes a soggy bun?   The flavors of the peppers, pickle, tomato, onions, and green relish worked well together, the hot dog itself had a little snap to it, so I assume it was close to the real thing, however, I would try a different dog next time. As for the sides, the zucchini sticks were plentiful and had good crisp to them, but the chili on the fries did seem canned.   For a hot dog, this place was just okay. I'd try it again, just because of the variety on the menu. The staff were friendly and the atmosphere was very relaxed.

l05D8UNG6l6BNRbfV0SlzQ.text: There's no place like Great Links! There are very few places that you can go to here in Las Vegas where you actually feel like you're not in Las Vegas. And Great Links has the formula to make you feel like you're one of their own! The first time I had a Great Links signature hot dog, I tried the "Mob Boss" (pictured). I can't even come up with the words to describe how full of flavor (and calories) it is! Their hot dogs are tasty, the marinate sauce wasn't special, but was still good, the peppers are grilled, and the best part is the mozzarella sticks in it! YUM!  One of the treats that Great Links offers is their fresh raspberry iced tea! SO BOMB! it's taDAfor! The staff is really friendly and welcoming and the environment is really chill. If you go there, you'll see that this place has definitely made an impression on Yelp because of all the stickers all over the place. The time I came here was for a Laker game and the flat screens they have up sufficed for the entertainment and the cook (I forgot his name :x) is a HUGE Laker fan also! He made the dinner interesting with all the cheering and comments to the tv screen.  The setup of Great Links isn't like any other place here in Las Vegas and I'd have to say, aside from the great customer service, it would be the coolest part of this great Vegas spot! There aren't a lot of places set up this way so it makes it even more special! Their menu includes vegetarian dishes, beer brats cooked and marinated on the spot, a ton of different variances of their hot dog recipes! They also have sausages for the hot & spicy lovers out there. Their Italian fries are a basket OD garlic-y goodness! I highly recommend extra crisy shoestring fries! Perfect addition to any hot dog combination! I also tried their Vegas fries! This isn't for the light-hearted French fry lover; or even the heavy hearted (HIGH IN CALORIES, but good!) but if a friend orders them, grab a fork and grab a bite! Definitely worth a try!  I will have to come back to try the rest of their colorful palette of hot dogs and fries! Their great customer service bumps them up a star also! Go great with Great Links! :)

VGAKmH9bUmafPNfjw-Nb1w.text: Located very close to where I live and have shopped at neighboring businesses but never stopped here.  Went last night and what a surprise!  Had no idea they would have such an extensive menu.  Robert was awesome - watched him interact with other customers and his customer service was the best!!  Had the Cheese Steak Philly Style - Excellent!  Will be making Great Links a regular stop on my way home from work!

_uH4aMClT5Fe_ZBXgj-HVA.text: Between the Chicago dog and the Italian sausage, this place is doing it right. Try the Italian fries, definitely delicious with the root beer. Beer battered fried mushrooms are also a hit for me. They have fast and friendly service even on the busiest of afternoons.

BI98Dwl2P3_29OeFaB2CRw.text: I can taste why this place is usually hopping. Good dogs, cold brews, very casual and comfy.  Come as you are. Great prices, too. Last time, my upgraded  ballpark dog was as good or better than at Cashman Field or any other ballpark I've been to. Hah.  Today, BF having classic chili & I'm going for the Streets of New York dog with light sauerkraut, spicy mustard. Always gotta upgrade to the 1/4 lb all beef dog in a grilled hoagie bun.  Mmmmmm!

TSmtYd_zl_aM5hE4_Rznsg.text: This is one of those places that remind me of New York thank you for bringing this into town best hot dogs I've had in forever since I've been here in Las Vegas good job guys very friendly service the owner is awesome

wToaKTssMbzBjPwKpvFCmQ.text: I've driven by this place for years & recently saw the reviews & went for it.  Yes it is a small place & it  can fill up quick so luckily I called in my order which was ready within 10 min. Portion sizes were great  for the  prices paid.  The food was definitely better than I expected. I didn't expect much from the mob boss hot dog because the marinara threw me off, but I think that's what made it taste great! The  chili cheese fries & mozzarella sticks aren't salty like other places either so that was  definitely a  plus. I  love mozzarella  sticks but it  sucks when  they're  so salty.  My daughter had the chicken bruschetta sandwich & she loved it! Mind you she doesn't eat bread,cheese, or any vegetable unless you bid them all somehow. My son had a meatball sandwich & loved it as well.   The staff was very friendly when we walked in. The lady who took my order was very patient when my phone was acting out when I called to place my order. Also they are very business friendly as well, several business cards are laid out on the counter & I was able to put my husband's business cards out as well. A lot of other restaurants won't let you do that unless you have some type of friendship/relationship with the owner.   This was our first time here & it won't definitely be our last! =)

I_ljfvZv27wPJAfVKdUQFA.text: Great Links Grill, on Craig and Jones, is by far and away the best restaurant of it's type I have experienced. The food is outstanding, especially the Linkski Kielbasa (my recommendation), the service is wonderful, and they even have vegetarian options for all of their meat choices, without sacrificing the menu options. All of the employees are great to chat with as well. Prices are very reasonable for the excellent quality and quantity, and the atmosphere couldn't be more welcoming. I whole-heartedly recommend the place.

MWZVkYCBNuoY2KZ1pmVT9w.text: The good was amazing but the service left something to be desired. Better to go in small groups as there is VERY limited seating available.

Oi133P-nmfiLEyTIQGl-tA.text: Pretty good hotdog. Don't usually eat them. Husband loves them he came out very happy, didn't feel sick after eating it. Ordered the natural fries they were delicious. Will come back.

-VXzlEEjcI0rEvCN44Cr4g.text: So everything I've ate here has been well cooked, seasoned, and delicious! That goes for cheeseburgers, Philly cheesesteaks, chili cheese fries, fried zucchini, mozzarella sticks, etc. I love the fact I can get an ice cold beer also. My only complaint is sometimes it takes a little long but in the end it's worth the wait. My aunt and uncle love the place so much they had a private party there for their anniversary. Hahaha! Keep it up Great Links and my belt will get tighter.

l_96Z-q1etP2_1FlXyjNSA.text: Great Chicago dog and chili cheese dog. Staff is very friendly. A cool place that we look forward to visiting again.

VgxqNuZp4y-_MC_f1SN41g.text: I'm going to abandon my typically structured article and opening 'cliffhanger' paragraph and just skip right to it on this one: this sucked. Great Links' website claims right on the main page that they were voted the best burger in Las Vegas (!!!!). Who were they up against? This is insane! I know everyone has their own opinions, including me, but out of the 70+ burger places I've eaten at in town I'd say 95% of them are better than this. Who the hell voted? What other places was this up against? Come on!  The restaurant interior is typical strip mall fare, with the griddle and deep fryers right in the open. The menu features hot dogs, sausages, burgers, sandwiches, fish...you name it. The key words to this menu are: frozen, premade, generic, and Boar's Head. Think generic pre-packed sausages and dogs, frozen patties, frozen fries... Sitting at the counter by the griddle I witnessed them pulling their sausages out of Boar's Head packages, frozen patties thrown right on the griddle, generic frozen crinkle cut fries dumped right out of their plain grocery store bags into a measuring bowl and into the fryer. While sitting near the griddle the only 'fresh' items I noticed were the pre-cut veggies they were pulling out of the fridge to throw on the griddle.  My frozen burger patty was dropped right on the grill to be overcooked with everything else on there. The meat was very generic, not that flavorful, and definitely not the winner of any 'best of' contest I can think of. There was a huge piece of tough, thick lettuce on the burger, a small amount of mushrooms I could barely taste, well-melted swiss cheese and a couple of thin tomato slices. The bun was grilled well, but extremely plain and non-existent. Nothing about this burger stood out, other than the fact I could find it in any backyard bbq or at an overpriced crappy food stand at any sports event.  The thin, overcooked generic fries were exactly that. I can't stress how ridiculously typical this meal was; I would give it a fairly negative review just on all that, but combine it with the 'best burger' claim and it infuriates me. To top it off my meal came to $13.26, which is equal to or more than plenty of other fantastic burgers I've eaten all around town that are definitely worthy of some best burger claims in many categories. I can't recommend paying to eat anything here because you could purchase pretty much the same ingredients at any grocery store and do what they do in your backyard. Argh.

zXBjgllEXUSWH83TythvCA.text: First time here found it thanks to all of you wonderful yelpers...and I have to say GREAT FOOD GREAT PEOPLE AND GREAT AND WARM SERVICE I will definitely be going back. As soon as we walked in we received a warm welcome and were seated right away the server was a delight and really helped us with our choices as this was our first time here the atmosphere was nice and clean and the food WOW I love it and at a terrific price they made pastrami chili cheese fries at request and they were delicious the Las Vegas chili dog was soo good and we loved the cheese fries and all you can drink sodas all that for 20$ can't beat that.......

rNuMISpnduxEbBOqf0w-zA.text: This is my first time coming here. I live 4 blocks away. This 1 star review is based on the following: I walked in...no one greeted me. uKChfeCJGeDnvjtY0TZilw.text: When you are looking for inexpensive and calorie filled food this is the place to stop. The chili cheese hotdog my wife had was tasty. I love the kids meal basket with like every single kid food in it (Corn dog, grilled cheese, tater tots, chicken fingers).  My husband loves pretty much everything there. The menu is large and there are tons of options. They never give me a hard time about customizing either.

8YxiM6LhrqfAyYeTcJko0Q.text: This place is a joke! Right when you walk in there is a sign saying to seat your self. I have two kids so I decided to sit in the back table because I know my kids can be loud at times. And because there is no way I can sit a two year old on a high table were he can fall and injure himself. We waited for our food and when we got the food it was great! But the service was mediocre along with the so called owners son. A party of 7 entered the restaurant and they wanted me and my family to move because they needed to sit them. I was in the middle of my meal so I said no! They wanted us to move when there was another big table next to us. It made no sense. V2S-PsPm-8vg0yv5ajnYDQ.text: Ok first time here & ordered 3 Chicago Dogs, a bratwurst, a Pastrami with Swiss cheese & Mushrooms no onions or mustard, an order of fried Mushrooms & a order of fries. Chicago dogs were ok nothing special but not bad. The bratwurst came with no onions or mustard even though we asked for it. The Pastrami came with onions & Mustard & no Mushrooms. The fried Mushrooms the batter on the inside is still raw & Mushrooms are cold. Overall a big disappointment.

ivPXGkoKVos8NDeaDYEBIw.text: I know, I know. Who goes to a place named Great Links Brewhouse and orders a Burger and ice water.  Well... that was me today.  Hey, they do have a sticker on the entrance and throughout the place that they competed on Burger Wars sponsored by Fox 5 so they must have decent Burgers.    I went with the Pastrami burger which was slightly over cooked with grilled onions, spicy mustard and melted provo with pastrami piled on top of a 1/3 LB meat patty.  Good combo, I do like a little heavier mustard on mine which I added. Besides the burger having a char to it this definitely satisfied my burger craving I had today.    To accompany my burger I went with the Italian Fries topped with Italian seasoning and grated parmesan cheese. These were tasty fries.  The parmesan began melting which made them even better half way through the meal.    Overall visit was solid, I will be back to try one of there monster dogs.  They have several varieties of topping combinations including the classic Chicago Style.  I think my first choice will be the chili dog. I saw one being brought to another table and I almost had to change my mind.

173PksnrXc1kOA2QdplQwg.text: Soooo good! I'm leaving here so very full. Had the garlic fries and a ciabatta chicken sandwich and mob boss hot dog. Every ounce was delicious!! Staff was awesome priced right.

TmIEyVMNwxeE491fWWF3Og.text: I'm up in arms that it's taken me so long to try out Great Links Brewhouse & Grill. I really have no excuse. It's close to home, has great Yelp reviews, and even has veggie dogs on the menu. Come to find out not only do they have offer veggie hot dogs, they have a full blown vegetarian faux meat menu that includes veggie chili, brats, cheese steak, bacon, and chicken nuggets! Veggie items are priced the same as their meaty counterparts. I squealed in excitement and vowed to be a regular customer if the food was good. Ladies and gents, I was not disappointed.   DELUXE CHILI CHEESE DOG ($5.49): Covered in vegetarian chili, cheddar cheese, and jalapeno slices (sans onions). A few slices of veggie bacon were tucked in the veggie hot dog. Tasted awesome, and I'm so glad to have an eatery that really caters to the vegetarian community. I only wish the cheese was more melt-y. 4/5  LAS VEGAS CHILI DOG ($5.49): This dog comes with white chili and is an upgraded version to the traditional dog. Cayenne sour cream and pepper jack cheese were some of the unexpected ingredients. Husband liked it! 4/5  ITALIAN FRIES ($4.29): Loaded with parmesan cheese. Not what I'm used to but we were happy with these fries. 4/5  ZUCCHINI STYX ($4.99): These were just okay. Probably won't order them again. The zucchini was too squishy. 2/5  VIBE: Small, casual hot dog joint. 4/5  SERVICE: Upon walking in, we thought we were supposed to order at the counter but we were instructed to sit down at a table. Our waitress was super nice and checked in on us often. As we left the guys working behind the counter waved and bid us a friendly farewell. 4/5  GOOD TO KNOW: They have a BOGO coupon in the Entertainment Book, up to $6.   YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #240

UBLRxowtyo8cltb7g2s1oQ.text: Received order and it was incomplete.  Called and they transferred me to the chef.  He said it was their fault on the popper sauce but not the sandwich. He was totally rude and disrespectful. When I asked his name he hung up the phone.  Plenty of other eateries in town, never again.

HLNYyHbb2mSTjAIR-Es61g.text: Went in at 8:25 pm 08/29/17 and was told they close in 3 minutes when sign clearly said 9. Pretty much was stopped before I could ask anything or order. I could have been in here for a catering event.   Anyway if management sees this you should welcome all guest and not push them away especially if you are a paying customer.   I would check your cameras to validate my complaint.

9bi-R583msyyewfzVaETZQ.text: It's no Dog Haus*, but damn I was surprised by the dogs here! Large menu of hotdog and sausage options, along with kicked-up fries and tots, burgers, and even some chicken options.   VEGAS CHILI DOG: Sage sausage white chili, pepper jack cheese, relish, tomatoes, cayenne sour cream, and spicy mustard. I don't think I've had white chili before, but I definitely dig it on hot dogs! This pick was loaded up and practically needed a fork to eat, great chili and good snap on the standard dog. MOB BOSS: Grilled onions, peppers, and mushrooms, with marinara sauce, tons of parm, and two cheese sticks. Get this with hot Italian sausage for the full effect. Again, covered in toppings and filling enough to be a meal. Great flavor in the sausage, too.  Opted for standard tots as our side, and we were encouraged to try a dipping sauce- opted for the fry sauce and was not disappointed. Crisp, fresh-made tots and ample, lightly-spiced fry sauce. Good light side to balance out the heavy hotdogs.  Signage indicates that they provide table service if you dine in, but we (and other visitors during our visit) used the walk-up and order method. Guys behind the counter were friendly.  *Re: Dog Haus is a part butcher store, part hot dog restaurant in LA with truly gourmet concoctions. It's a few steps up from Great Links, but I can appreciate them both.

vWFczT9LNYdpzEzmeQx1NA.text: Their dogs have that snap when you bite into them and have a nice spice to it.   Try their coleslaw dog, the spiciness of their dog + the cooling taste of slaw + the 100+ degree Vegas dry heat = nirvana  I'm craving their Chicago dog right now.

tX2M3ZFh-308FEnYzaIXWQ.text: Awesome sausage dogs and hamburgers. Today we tried the Italian fries, BOMB! My son had the sage chili on his dog. After several times of trying it I have finally decided that I do not like the sage chili. It is to aromatic strong and tasting. Cool idea though.

ecqKen4NtXpZdFH27dSnXA.text: The garlic cheese fries are very yummy, so are the ones that taste like potato chips. I had the turkey burger with cheese and mushrooms on lettuce and tomato, no bun. Very good. Kids had cheese burgers which were a tad dry. Hubby had the Parmesan chicken sandwich, he liked it. Some cons: it's summertime and the place got hot even with the fans going. Cram too many people in at once. They have bar seating, but it's right on top of the grills. If you can, order to go. It's worth it. Very reasonably priced. Charlie, one of the servers is extremely nice.

B1kawbSOf2g5ez7A-_cX0Q.text: Great food, large portions, great price and great service. What else can you ask for? This was our first time here and Charlie helped us make some great choices.

qiIPhW5u3ScUUOxCDMDIbg.text: The chili fries and burger we got were very good, prices were good as well. However, my review is mainly for the service. The young lady that waited on us was very friendly, efficient, and overall did an excellent job. I watched her handle one rude group of people after another without batting an eye. I don't know when it became acceptable to treat other people this way, but this young lady certainly didn't let it bother her!  It's unfortunate that people are jerks but she did an AMAZING job!

YYuCYgX_5lwcGDfxPGS_qQ.text: First time here. Came because they were four star on Yelp. Told them it was our first time and asked what they would recommend. Guy said we have a lot just look over the menu. Really?? No personal recommendations. Not that impressed. Mozzarella sticks and fries from a frozen bag and tasted like it, no special seasoning or anything. Burger was good but I was hoping for a delicious juicy burger. Left a little disappointed based on four stars and reviews.

Ct_3GWafNHNx6TwYmA2uPA.text: Today was the first time I've been to this place, so it took me awhile to read through the menu to decide. The server was understanding, brought me my drink, and let me work my way through the menu.   They have many choices for hot dogs, sausages and burgers along with many other choices, I almost ordered fish and chips.They had a chili burger, normally I make sure whether it's chili the red soup stuff or chili the green pepper, reading the description it said white chili, since I had no idea what that was, I asked the server. She brought me a sample. It's made with a sage sausage, it's a lot like the country gravy I make for biscuits and gravy.  I ended up ordering a patty melt. Cheese, grilled onions, burger on grilled dark rye. It was good, not great, but good. The burger patty was lacking, it appeared to be a frozen formed patty, dry after cooking. The preparation, of the sandwich, was great, with a fresh burger patty, that was still juicy, it would have been a great sandwich.  The server, I didn't get the name, an attractive young lady at lunch time on 6/19/2014. She was friendly, helpful, attentive, everything a person in customer service should be.   I've read all the reviews, they allude to the burgers winning awards, so my burger may have been an aberration. I would say, I will go back and try a burger again, but after reading the reviews about the snap in the dogs, I want to try one of them. Funny thing is, I saw the Great Links sign and I actual went in this place for a hot dog, got lost in the menu and ended up ordering a burger.  I believe the 1/2 lb patty melt, I had, was about $7.50, which is about the going price for this type of sandwich, so the price is reasonable.  I will be back, you should give it a try.

7GAp4vV0o1DCvIlk6yDspw.text: Terrific take on classic fare! We each had the Great Linski Kielbasa and WOW, what a great choice!  It seems unlikely you could go wrong here and you DO want to hurry in...it's just a great choice for a solid meal that is interesting, satisfying and very generous in its size.

58gDGSGxS7Qeo-Gp9y8jiQ.text: You know a hot dog is amazing when every single bite has that great crisp as you bite into the casing and at Great Links, you get that in every bite. But it's not just an amazing hot dog restaurant. There are tons of things on the menu from hamburgers to polish sausages to fries and philly cheese. Don't forget to try the fried pickle spears! They even have a selection of beers on tap to go with that Chicago dog complete with bright green relish.  The only reason I give the spot four stars is because of the size. They definitely need to expand but wasn't too busy when we stopped in.  They even have breakfast on the weekends although I haven't tried. Definitely recommend this spot for a great lunch!

All65WJnKpWPl80xm5R2cQ.text: I love this place! It has become our go to weekend spot and the food never fails. Sundays can get pretty crazy and busy but the food is always consistent. I have never ordered anything that I haven't liked. Great food at great prices!

DvprXzAO54jTP2iPvjK8Ww.text: Holy geez this place is great!! Especially if you're a vegetarian! That's right, I said vegetarian. Not something commonly heard at a burger and hot dog joint they have vegan hot dogs, sausages, patties, you can literally replace anything on the menu to make it vegetarian and even vegan friendly. Oh and did I mention its stupid amazing delicious! I got the mushroom swiss burger (seriously that peppercorn mayo) and my husband got the jalapeno guacamole cheeseburger (an onion ring stuffed with guac, c'mon) and cheesy buffalo fries, all meat free. The staff is also really great and friendly. We stayed a little after just to chat. Defiantly going back very soon! P.s don't forget to get a local draft root beer!

rEKDbKqiOvCVeDXCsHfxcg.text: This rating is for breakfast. My advice is, go anywhere else besides great links for breakfast. Our food. Took a long time, the "lightly seasoned hash browns" had so much seasoning on them to where they didn't even taste like potatoes and they were smashed flat and they were greasy. We ordered the eggs scrambled soft and they came scrambled hard. The ham steak was generic and quite salty. Toast is a side order  ?? We also had burgers there on another occasion and the burgers were decent but their prices are too high for the product delivered. We will not be going back. Ever.

VUee-V9UWI8GmoogWuCFsA.text: Been coming since they opened (and even prior when he had a cart outside lowes!)    Been about 6 months though and decided its been too long.  As always, friendly and good food - never disappoints. Chicago dog, mobster dog, grilled cheese and the oh so sinfully good fried pickles.  Forgot what I was missing.

P0grbfyhyFqyseoE0SzUvQ.text: Chicago dog and cheese fries lived up to the Yelp recommendation.  Waitress was on top of her game and food was excellent. No reason to give it less than 5 stars

OgRiKPfdjVgbBX4oDqFNFg.text: I'm a woman who knows her way around a dog - both the male variety and the frankfurter type. Ok, no more man bashing! I like men, might even review them as a a group, However, decided not to resist the joke. So, no offense right? Plus, I'm about to tell you all about a great place. so forgive me, this one time. Ok, locally owned, which I LOVE. Family has fought hard to keep the place going and has had some incredible challenges, including the wife's battle with cancer. However, they remain committed to good food, good service, and good attitudes. I know they won a burger competition put on by Fox 5. Not much staff turnover which tells me a lot. They had a coupon in last year's Entertainment Book. I haven't checked the new one. Haven't seen them on Groupon or Living Social. I need to check Restaurants.com, Prices are fair without a coupon though and they have meal deals. Before I forget, they offer some very interesting vegetarian options. I would order one to try it, but who am I kidding? I'm there for the dogs. Sometimes, I'm there for the clams. Sometimes, for the rueben, but never for the veggies. Wait, do breaded and fried mushrooms count? Incredibly large menu, which I'm sure they do to please customers but must be hard to maintain. They even do breakfast. My favorite is the Atlanta dog. Not to be a diva, but I special order mine and they always remember. I like the dog in the natural casing. They do the dog a little longer for me. They also take the cole slaw out of the fridge before they start the dog cause I don't want cold slaw to cool off the hot dog. Ok, feel free to groan. I swear I didn't mean the pun. I try to be a woman of integrity, so I'm going to leave it. I also like the red onion sauce - that might be the NY dog. Shame that I was born in NY and I'm not sure which is my dog. Doesn't matter cause the dogs are described on the menu. :Plus you can order whatever you would like. I'm not much of a fry girl, but you need to order them here. They offer different kinds and great toppings. They have beer, which I haven't had yet. Well, I've had beer, just not at Great Links. They have ice cream and shakes, both of which I have had and enjoyed. Great local place with quality junk food. I'm not sure it gets better than that.

DHsr5uP5e_bHDD18jxrXFg.text: We love having breakfast here. Great food. Good people. If you're looking for a burger/dog joint. This is it. They allow you to make whatever your heart desires. Everything is a la carte, which is fine, you can mix and match. Prices are great for the quality of food.  Owner is a very humble guy. Unless you asked, you would not know that he is who he is.

m4BdxKrTKNIzD5Qk0EnTdg.text: I originally started going to great links for lunch and dinner but one day I stumbled in there earlier in the day and discovered a breakfast menu. I lucked out that day because the breakfast is delicious. They serve fresh eggs potatoes biscuits and gravy and you get any link you choose to add to Your breakfast. The staff is nice and friendly and your sure to have a good time. Sometimes it's gets busy and its wait but well worth it. Long story short anytime of the day you can go to great links and enjoy a good hearty meal

JcdSX8avJ2iSPqzLsM-G-g.text: It's been a few years since I've been here (just kinda forgot it existed after moving to another part of town) but was over here today and craving a good hot dog. I just got off a long day at work and decided to stop here and pick something up. It was soooooo good. I waited a wee bit longer than I remember for a take out order but the cook threw in dessert for the wait which I didn't mind waiting. Thanks again for blowing my mind!   Ps. Do dine in unless it's a short drive. Travels okay, still good after my 15-20 minute commute.

5wSW51bJWqOHysj3dNu9Ww.text: Some of the best food that I have had on this part of town. The food was phenomenal, and I can't wait to go here again. I would suggest ordering the patty melt on rye, or the cheesesteak.

3E5y1v6IFoHT_2vkcio0hQ.text: I am a sucker for family owned bar and grills, but the food here makes it easy!  The Pastrami cheeseburger was absolutely delicious, the price was amazingly low, and the beer is cold.    I'll be back to try out the rest of the menu.

But waiting for the check was a little bit of a wait as there was a steady stream of people coming in and going out.  I would definitely come back

oxd2UoHJhrAfv-aBu5QHZg.text: I enjoyed the atmosphere of this place. My fries were burnt but I didn't care as much because I didn't want to eat them anyway, and my sandwich was still dry even after I added mayo. Their hot dogs were great as I tried some from my husband's  order. I'd go back again to try other items but will def say something if we get burnt fries again.

10DKhiNsdNEEhQwoMEkHzw.text: The food in this place is ridiculous! Ridiculously delicious! Our server/waiter/host/comedian was really nice! Extra nice to the kids! You can probably order anything on the menu and will be satisfied.  Definitely will came here again and again!

lWnXE8RdYqXxXJQcv2mIIA.text: I have ordered take out from here before & dined in. I have not been disappointed in any way, shape, or form. The food is so delicious! Fresh, quality ingredients! Great customer service! You will NOT regret it. The Philly Steak Sandwich & Ortega Cheeseburger is superb!

TuWPiCFHzZeG7ZM7w9B2Ng.text: All the hot dogs here are Boar's Head, but you can choose skinless or a turkey dog. Walking in there were several employees that greeted us. We chose a table near the window and started looking through the menu. The menu offers a variety of not just hot dogs, but also sausage, burgers, sandwiches, chicken, fish, and salad.    Given the name, I had to try a hot dog the first time! Priced at $4.59 I ordered the "Philly Griller dog" that had grilled peppers, onion and cheese sauce. Yum! I couldn't even eat the whole thing so half went to hubby who didn't care for the char taste, but I like a good charred dog. The peppers and onions had a great flavor and there was a fair amount of cheese sauce. I also had some "Italian Fries" priced at $4.29 and had my choice of shoestring or crinkle-cut. I chose the shoestring and it was tossed in a garlic butter sauce and topped with parmesan cheese and Italian seasoning. These were good! I asked for a side of ranch to dip them in and the ranch was good. Our server was nice and checked on us often. I do feel the restaurant could be cleaner inside, but there was a good vibe and I'd go back. You can place your order for pick-up as well.

dFLICc5zh7WUdrdY-to3tg.text: OMG! If you haven't been here it's a must try absolutely amazing food.  The staff is awesome. Every single thing I've had is amazing.  Wet Italian beef, different hot dogs, especially the one with marinara and mozzarella sticks omg to die for! Last time I ordered the beef and cheddar wow delicious! My boyfriend is from Chicago and we just love the food, beer and pleasant staff. Awesome place!!

rgD9S9hT3Yt7wphLCK8jxg.text: With a strong hankering for a different kind of hot dog I was surprised to find a specialty eatery close to my side of town. As I entered I was greeted by one of the staff and was immediately consumed with the aroma of what I came for. The establishment is very clean and you have your choice of sitting at the counter or a table which seat either two or 4 patrons. Mind you, it's not a large business but they do well with the space they have.  The menu is very descriptive that answers all your questions as to "what's in it" Expect to wait for your order as they take meticulous pride in creating your dog.  I ordered the Chicago Dog and some tator tots that rocked. Cooked to crunchy perfection and I couldn't stop popping them in my mouth. loved em. Exactly what I was craving. As I gobbled it down like my friends pet Shepherd my first thought was this is great hangover food. So I ordered a different dog because when your hungover you can't just eat one. Lol

6HoeJF4VSxAKYP7SODXXOA.text: I am beyond impressed with ashley the server. I couldnt imagine better service and i dont let things like that go unnoticed. I would come back here just to see her. The food is just to die for and her helping us just made everything 5 stars. Well deserved, she definitely deserves a raise for the impeccable job she does! Kept us laughing and happy to be there! Keep her around! We will be back!!!!   Thank you!! Very appreciated!

Jy3poh_MH3w1dSSQXuSeaw.text: This is a grill, cooked to order in open kitchen. This is a great place to meet a friend, have a cold beer, great dog, watch a game, tease the staff (they flip it right back). Now this isn't a family atmosphere, or a place designed with high end service or patient wait staff... this is an old school grille...like it should be. Try a Mob Boss Dog with Italian Fries..and a freaking cold beer..    Good job guys!

cd2_HAWI0VPbVOvKgoMKsA.text: Holy smokes the dog I got was delicious! Think it's called the 9th island luau special. It was topped w/ BBQ pulled pork, mozzarella, potato hash, and a mango salsa! Service was friendly (I just ordered to go but I was greeted quickly, order taken and food made quickly to order). Best hot dog I've had. They've got about 20+ choices, plus a bar, and other sandwiches/ drinks/ sides, even soup and salads. I'll definitely be back to try other things. Awesome little neighborhood spot, next to my favorite nail place and Starbucks. What else do u need lol?!

V24DyurQ64izMT815peoJg.text: I absolutely LOVE Great Links. Now that I've moved from Vegas, I miss it all of the time. I used to eat here for lunch on the weekends, now I wish I'd gone even more. It's a small establishment on Craig Rd near 95, reminds me of a diner. They have many other options besides hot dogs, including brats and chicken, with vegetarian selections as well. There's a decent selection of beers, mostly bottles, and root beer on tap!  I always get the veggie dogs, and I wish I knew what brand they used. They taste better and have better texture than all other vegetarian hot dogs. The Chicago dog is my fav, and I also love the NY dog with sauerkraut and mustard. I definitely recommend trying their white Vegas chili, whether it's on fries or a dog. Sausage and sage is an awesome combination and it's delicious. Also, cannot get enough of the grillmaster fries, oh my they're addictive.   The service is always great. This place draws a local crowd, seems like many people know the owners/employees. I've had many different waiters/waitresses, eventually a few times each. Everyone is friendly and attentive.  I miss it so much ... keep up the great food and service and thanks for the memories! Don't change a thing!
