Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicago dog (vegetarian)

B8cYM97InTis5gPo2QsV0Q.text: I love this place there food is amazing and people that are irk here are so nice I eat here with family when ever I can. If you are looking for a great Philly cheese steak come here ooo and cold beer

v0k6RqqzSDskpZuOzDv6yA.text: This place is super close to my house and have been coming here for years. If your looking for yummy comfort food then eat here! The staff is super friendly and they always recognize us when we come in! We always sit at the bar, we like watching the food get cooked! Great family owned establishment. Great prices. Extensive menu options and yummy food!   **TIP: This place can get very busy, only one fry cook and one griller. But it's well worth the few extra minutes it takes to get your food!

AXhLYP6w1aDUIKed6egZNA.text: Decided to go to this place because I tried a different restaurant and the food was horrible. So I came here and finally got some great food. The staff was amazing and the restaurant was clean definitely will come here again

opqfrPibox3VjBLXLVmwGw.text: Vegas needs more places exactly like this! Not only do they make amazing assed hot dogs, they also have something called a pastrami cheeseburger (I CAN HAS?). Their menu is extensive and goes anywhere from a plain hot dog to full on Chicago dogs and Caesar salads.  For such a small place they had quite the selection of beers (by the bottle), too.      I went with the Chicago dog and was excited to see they use the bright green relish. I have never been to Chicago, but I feel even the most extreme purist would delight in this party in your mouth. The wiener (hehe) was crisp with every bite and the toppings were fresh! The service felt familiar and could be confused with anywhere but Vegas. I haven't even gotten to the best part... The Cottage fries. Made fresh with each order, they are fried to perfection and lightly seasoned with sea salt. No ketchup needed. I will go back just for these. I hear they are crowded on Sunday Mornings, next time I go I'll be sure to go for breakfast.

pzFDg4yIW912PjWRO4TRMA.text: After seeing Peter A's review, I totally had to check it out. I've been craving a burger lately but didn't feel like traveling too far. Plus who can pass up a hot dog! We walked into a pretty crowded place on a Sunday at 1pm. We sat down and ordered some drinks. My husband and I debated the menu for a bit. There were so many things that sounded so good. We finally decided on an order of buffalo cheesy fries, a guacamole jalapeno burger for me, a pastrami burger for hubby, a corn dog kids meal and a kraut dog to share.  Buffalo cheesy fries - slightly tangy sauce with melted cheese. They weren't salty or spicy but were good. Guacamole jalapeno burger - I devoured this. The guacamole was creamy. There were just enough jalapenos to give it a little kick without overpowering it. Yummy deliciousness.  Pastrami burger - I took a bite. I just had to. It looked too good. The mustard had just the right kick. The pastrami complimented the burger in such the right way.  Kraut dog - oh snap... Literally! It was so good. Just enough spicy mustard and kraut. The kraut was crisp and wasn't too sour.  Corn dog - nothing special. The stick said Foster's Farm.   This is going to be my local go to for a good burger and hot dog.

mPfhwLjtwAypgaN1NH7rAg.text: I have eaten here many times.  The food is always fresh, hot & yummy.  Prices are pretty average.  You do get large portions too.  I recommend to anyone looking for some great gut bomb food.

AsK6miHlGwq4OxUZ7_MbJg.text: Words do no justice... this place serves out of this world hot dogs with all kinds of fixings.  It was seriously hard to choose which one to order!  But no problem, since hubby and I will definitely be going back to sample more!   This time, I ordered the New Yorker - topped with onion sauce, sauerkraut and spicy mustard.  The casing snapped when I bit into it.. heaven!  My husband tried the Chicago style and it disappeared down his gullet in seconds!   In addition to hot dogs, they also offer bratwurst, Italian sausage, chicken sausage, kielbasa, (+ more but I can't remember all the types now), also crisp fries with all kinds of toppings, burgers, fried shrimp, fish and chips, salads, etc.  The place was hopping when we visited, friendly staff, happy eating people - a winning combination!   For me, a real Northwest Vegas hidden treat!

XuYVO-SW90waaCS4ZMGmuA.text: I literally pass by this place every single day.  Always, was curious and a friend, said it was good. So what the hell. First and foremost, the menu is extensive. Every type of hot dog, made every way possible, with every topping you could ever imagine. Not only that, but they had burgers as well and sandwiches. They had you're mushroom burger, patty melts, and some creative burgers with ingredients I have never seen mixed together. Very original. I had the Pastrami Melt. Good old pastrami, grilled onions, mustard and swill on grilled rye. It was dead on, geat sandwich, very filling. For 5.99$ I was very satisfied. I had some of the italian fries. Those were good, I wish they put a little bit more of the garlic butter, and a little less parmesan cheese. That might just be me though, whenever butter is part of the equation, you better use a lot of it, or not at all. Go big or go home. I had a bite of the patty melt, my friend had. very delicious. This is small operation that obviously knows what they are doing and have a great thing going. I am a fan, and will go here more, the menu is so big, it entices you to come back and try the other stuff.

KeR7yh7zg0jkzCK7bfB9Tg.text: The second time eating here and both times less than satisfied. The first time I was so excited to have a childhood favorite Frito pie, but too my surprise the chili was sour like the meat was bad!!! Then the second time I thought just try something they are known for... Hot Links!!! But even that was gross!!!!!! The only reason why it gets two stars is because my child loves the Grilled chz sandwich even if she told the lady she wanted chips and got fries!! Oh well ...  Good luck!

IVviR_wGpzWSu64DaM0CiA.text: We found this place on yelp. The dogs were great.  I tried the mob boss and who knew that combination could be so good.  My husband tried the slaw dog with chili and wanted a second one.  Good place, would come again.

mVZMqfFASVgzo7qmdPjTEw.text: Ate here with the whole family today and we enjoyed every bit of the food! The white sausage sage chili on the new Las Vegas dog is fantastic!! Highly recommend a stop here! The service is also outstanding!

onVXo4PUlrCxg3WlLWm5iw.text: This place is AWESOME!!!!!!  We moved to Vegas about a year ago and this is one of the first places we found that we love.  We've tried everything on the menu and love it all. In fact, we eat there about 4 or five times a month... The Philly Cheese Steak is INCREDILE!! Philly Style... Hot Links, Hot dogs... Oh and the burgers are off the chain.. The bread is so good. Not an average bun its really good...  I rarely write reviews but I simply had to do this one.. This place should have multiple locations in Vegas...

zIdieuH1aE2tiouFgaC51w.text: My husband and I went there on Sunday for lunch. I ordered the ball park dog, which has mustard, ketchup, relish and onions.. sounds good-hmm, and beer battered onion rings with a diet pop.  My husband ordered a kielbasa sausage, Italian fries and a diet pop.  Lets start off with the chopped onion on my hotdog!  the onion was chopped in quite large pieces and there were WAY TOO MANY PEICES ON ONE HOTDOG!! It tasted like they used the relish that has the cloves in it, so I didn't care for the relish on there, and they put soooo much mustard on it and barely any ketchup at all.. all in all, I was very disappointed with my hotdog.  The onion rings were quite tasty, light and crispy, just the way I like them.  My husbands purchase, well it came on a bun with the sausage cut into four small pieces, he took one out and it is the way they cooked it! so it kept falling apart on him, they didn't drain the sauerkraut that was put onto it so the bun got very soggy.. I don't know if anyone else likes sauerkraut juice dripping from your bun, but he sure didn't.  His Italian fries came with some kind of Italian seasoning and parm. cheese and olive oil. They put so much olive oil on his fries that when he was done eating them, there had to be at least a half a cup of oil in the bottom of his dish, they put way too much oil on them... he was very disappointed with both the sausage and the fries that he ordered... when we first got there he asked them to turn the tv down, we were really close to it, and they turned it down one... they have two tvs in there and my husband and I were the only customers in there at the time he asked them to turn it down, so that just wasn't right of them... when we first walked in and the waitress came and took our order I noticed she had gloves on, I was thinking that was good.. If I had realized that they don't change their gloves in between orders.. (they didn't that day while we were there) we would have asked them to change them. The guy that was working was walking around running his hands along the counters and knocking on the counters and touching it seemed everything then he didn't change his gloves when other people came in there... she didn't either.  We definitely will not be back to this place.. THE ONLY REASON I PUT TWO STARS ON HERE IS BECAUSE THEY DID HAVE GOOD ONION RINGS!

G_usH7lCzJaPwLtzBeJkIQ.text: Went by today for lunch. I have to say the LV Chili Dog was as good as it gets!!! Place was clean and so was the service. Met Guy the owner and chatted with him for a bit...Nice person, It's like you have known him for years. Will be bringing my family by for lunch or dinner soon.

KGnXV-_84EphNayRUfLTEw.text: We just ate here and can tell it's going to be one of our favorite places! The staff were super friendly and te atmosphere was relaxed. I had a Philly dog and my husband had a jersey hot sausage with onions. These had to be the best we have ever had!

hSJRA_3m9XsngrDkx8s_9A.text: I went here during the lunch rush on a Friday and this place was packed.  I was able to grab a table right away because the gal was quick to keep them bussed.  I ordered a number two thinking the dogs would be small like a Nathan's dog or something you could get at a grocery store.  I was wrong, they are big enough to need their own basket.  Luckily I was able to talk my husband into eating the second one for me.  Even though the place was busy, we were checked on four times.  I walked out the door stuffed and the bill, less than 20 bucks.  I will be back.

WQfY18lk9FwbdeI8zNyXbQ.text: Thumbs up! Great service, great food and very reasonably priced! Definitely worth the drive!

Kqj9NQm1Z-rFILP0r-80Eg.text: Hands down the fries are amazing. We order "The Deluxe Fries". The atmosphere is great. However I ordered a "cheese chili dog" and it was just average. And we also ordered "the streets of New York" and it was great. I will be going back again for sure.

6WALgs0Ma_B4MqAywsrq3w.text: Eh.  I read the reviews here and thought to give it a try since my husband loves hot dogs.  We ordered the cheese fries, Atlanta Slaw dog, San Antonio Dog and the Strawberry milkshake.  The milkshake was DE-LISH!  The cheese fries were a definite no - they used liquid cheese instead of the cheedar cheese and melting it onto the fries, so the fries were bland in flavor.  My husband had the hot dogs, and he said they didn't have much flavor.  He said the hot dog should have a better flavor, and anything additional should just make it taste that much better.  Our waiter never came by  to check if everything was ok, it was when we were paying for our check did another waiter asked how our experience was.

Q--inb3vacLddFpQqf47yQ.text: Found this on Yelp.  Amazed to find that it was a former Famous Uncle Al's since we come from Virginia Beach, the birthplace of the Uncle Al franchise.  Great links has expanded on Al's menu in a good way and we all enjoyed our picks from the big menu.  if you are in Virginia Beach, stop in the original Famous Uncle Al's on Shore Drive and meet the man himself - it's an experience.

aqQ8QurJhB9LWwyXwI8Frg.text: I've always lived by a rule of thumb that if you go to a burger place you have to get a burger, if you go to to a pizza place you get the pizza. So when I was coaxed into a hot dog place (not my ideal food) I decided to deviate from this plan, and I was shocked. Everything I've ordered from this place is great. They have had amazing burgers, chicken tenders, and they some how improved the mozzarella sticks by offering them as half moons.  Not the cheapest place in the world (My combo meal runs me around $11) I've introduced a few people to this place as well and they all enjoy it. The place is either empty or teeming. They have great carry-out which I recommend to everyone who may not like busy places. (Yet no matter how busy they get, you always get taken care of, or if you're impatient, you can just get up and get your own refill) It's a nice mix between casual fast food and a sit down restaurant.

yzWVdPZMM7A88pwo8fnrng.text: I walked in here after driving by it way too many times! This place is AMAZING!! The staff is insanely friendly and they KNOW their customers... I came in for my first time and asked the chef to surprise me with whatever he wanted to make and he knocked it out of the park with 2 killer hot dogs!!!! What a great place!!

cRlu9WAr0OTOJ0cRB6OSCA.text: I sat while the blonde girl at the register socialized. Somebody waved her down for a check, she did that...back to talking. Would have loved to try the food, but they don't seem to value customers.

6duqIsgr-gtGakN7OgvPDg.text: Great concept!  Great product!  Were out of guac... :(  Not staffed enough :(  The employees made up with smiles and teamwork.   Could have been an overall better experience, but maybe next time.

mYC6EsWY7KQOYUg10AzNug.text: This place has great food. Hot dogs are phenomenal, burgers, cheese steak... All good. Customer service is great. Both times we've gone so far the recommendations from our waitress were on point. (Thanks Kayla). Lots of beer choices if you want them, but still great for kids and families too.

Kx5CRLpZAW4AdnGKeuMVcQ.text: I was looking forward to this hot dog, and sorry Great Links, but it was pretty average....... nothing great here........ I guess they used to use Boars Head Hot Dogs, but they are no longer able to get them from their supplier. The hot dogs they get now are okay, but an all beef hot dog, not the beef and sausage blend like the Boars Head brand. I got the deluxe chili cheese hot dog and the deluxe chili cheese fries. The fry was the star of the show here, not the hot dog. Still, all in all the place is nice, the service is nice, just a little disappointed in the "Great Link" I was hoping for.

DLJrh9MXxVeVotPxc55jEg.text: My favorite American food spot in town. Don't skip the green beans, or the root beer floats, root beer on draft..... also they have vegetarian options which is nice too

0vG6ijX3wDjt0VqBO8JI1w.text: I honestly don't know how this place has an A rating and a 4 Star Yelp review.   Disclosure, we did eat our food, but that was because we sat at the counter observing the way our food was prepared.  Synopsis: 3 people working - hostess/server, 2 cooks/servers.   We sat at the counter, the restaurant was warm. The dining room is approximately 600 sq ft, all of 2 tables were taken. We waited about 10 minutes to have our orders taken. So, we observed the Blue glove guys, 1 on the fries and the other guy making the entrees. The hostess told the fry guy that he needed to wash some things because they were out....BLUE GLOVES...Fry guy put in some fried stuff and set the timer and left the front of the house to wash dishes. When the buzzer went off, he walked towards the fryer (while wiping his blue gloved hands with a paper towel) after washing dishes, and pulled out the fried stuff. At this point, the entree cook had a few dishes cooking. When he was done cooking, the entire flattop was full of sludge. He left for a few minutes, all while the sludge sat, and came back to lightly scrape the heavy sludge before he placed another sausage on the grill...GROSS! I forgot to mention that the hostess/cashier also handled food without a blue glove, and she dug her ear before grabbing a styrofoam container. The fryer guy kept on coming from the back to put things in the fryer, while wiping his BLUE GLOVED hand with a paper towel.  In addition to this, the condiment bottles were heavily soiled. It appeared that no one cared to clean them on a daily basis.   I will not be back.

FT3Zqaxv1JY-REk37WKbqg.text: I've been here a few times and this is my favorite place to get hot dogs in town. Great Links makes fantastic dogs, sausages and burgers, and everything is fresh and made to order.  One of my favorite things here is their green sage chili. There is nothing else quite like it and you just need to try it if you come here. It comes on their Vegas Dog, Vegas Burger or Vegas fries, and I always get one of these every time I come here. I've also had their normal chili, and it's very good to if you don't want to try something new, but it isn't unique like the sage chili is.  One awesome thing is that they will make any of their sausages the same way they will make any of their specialty dogs. The last time we were here my wife got the Kielbasa (the largest sausage) prepared like the Philly dog. It was smothered in sauteed onions, peppers and cheese on a special roll that has been lightly toasted. It was amazing and huge.  The hot links are also very good and this is a great place to grab a juicy burger. The only downside here, to me, is that their "brewhouse" in their name is a little misleading. They have just a few draft lines and some bottled beer, but nowhere near the selection as the name infers.  All in all this is just a killer place to go for big lunch or dinner. If hot dogs, burgers and sausages with lots of great toppings are your thing, check this place out.

srzNYf_60T_Sh-wNu9EnGQ.text: This place has the best hot dogs in town! The Las Vegas Chili dog and fries are a must!! And please don't forget the draft root beer...one word... DELICIOUS!!

QqBu7ayqXDrr148rGGyqkA.text: Great Links is one of my favorites - and - its family owned and operated (+++). We eat really enjoy eating lunch or dinner here when were in the area. It has a fun and energetic atmosphere with an open cooking area. The menu has something to offer everyone - check out their Vegetarian Section and choices of beverages/bottled beer.   My daughter loves watching our food cook from the high top bar area that over looks the grill not to mention the food & service is 100% spot on every time!   The cheese tatertots were crispy and fired to perfection. I ordered the Slaw Dog with an upgraded Hogue bun - totally worth the $2 charge. My daughter had the plain dog but their kid meal options are only $4 which includes fries and a drink. The BBQ cheese burger was nice and juice. Everything we wanted and more!

VHxS0lHBxJfqLqWGOVjcuw.text: Went here with the wife for lunch been here a few times and food is always on point the staff is very friendly but cleanliness is a real problem First the menus are paper and theres old food stained all over them, The cook slash order taker had gloves on but was handeling money then went  right back to cooking with same gloves my wife told me not to watch but thats just disgusting, catchup at table was watered down. We won't be back for a while but will give them one more shot cause the food is good with lots of options and nice people

dP36cXzZsMIIRGjKL8Z4Ag.text: I went in there on a Saturday night and found it was not busy. However the young waitress with glasses spent more time joking with the cooks than waiting on customers. I finally had to get up and ask her to take my order. By that time another customer demanded her money back because of the time it was taking and more customers came in wanting to pick up a to go order. A young cook took our order and an older cook brought our order out. The older cook was very rude. The food was good but I have to ask who is managing this place?  It's very sad when you say they food is good but the service personnel are a hot mess.

0V8bqP39RRA5v1V0EEASbw.text: I call in an order here probably twice a week! Their chili cheese dog is quality! I also love their sweet Italian. It's a very homey restaurant and i love that. Fresh and quick.

JkruGU3nhMiCSxkzDkY9GA.text: We were impressed. It is worth the visit. Friendly staff, chili is awesome, dogs are really good and I took the advice of a previous review and the Italian fries were great! We will definitely visit again!

SGRrSzGdqOMMSf8lR7_GRA.text: Craving a hot dog tonight so we stopped in and ordered a philly dog(grilled onions, peppers, and cheese sauce), jalapeno guacamole burger, tater tots, and grill master fries. The fries were an upgraded version of In and Out's animal style fries but sooooo much better!  Try them, you won't be disappointed!  The tater tots are always super crispy and we actually brought those home because we couldn't finish them. Their side orders of fries or tots are enough for two people to split. Prices are still really reasonable! I'm going to try their turkey burger next time!   FYI: lots of vegetarian options too!

X7Av5E9UVWk4VcBAGDRjyg.text: Awesome food and service, my son had the boss dog said it was amazing, I had the Rueben also 5 stars The only downfall was the water tasted like plastic I don't know why and it won't stop me from going back just don't drink the water

-8UFkd--CV_GBnkipeR5IA.text: Every time I come into Great Links It seems like I'm always let down by the food. The only thing worth ordering is the chili cheese fries.

Xe3NTUlKjZJrIW2X8b-sPQ.text: Amazing food great staff. Wife had cheeseburger and I had Philly cheese steak. Both came out perfect. We split an order of cheese fries. Excellent. Will absolutely be back I definitely want to try the chilli cheese fries yum.

-ZNEgSRx5BW4nYK9rFwk2g.text: We all wanted to get together and grab a bite to eat, but couldn't agree on a place to go. Finally, we decided to try somewhere new and this place popped up on yelp places near us. We all met up there and I have to say, I thought this place was going to be a lot bigger and more of a sit down dining place like a Red Robins or Applesbees since it's a Brewhouse and grill. It's a lot smaller than I was expecting. There wasn't a whole lot of room in there. Just one row of seating so you want to make sure you go at a good time or you won't be able to dine in and will have to get your stuff to go. They have a wall of bottles of beer that you can choose from. I was disappointed that we came in on a Friday night and they were out of their root beer on tap which is supposed to be one of the best things to try so I wasn't even able to get any like I wanted to. The food is a hit and miss. We all got different things to share so we could try a bunch of the menu items. Some things were really good and others I didn't really care for. I did really like the fried green beans. They'd probably be the only thing out of the things we did try, that I would go back to get. I got the pastrami cheeseburger and I can't say that I was impressed with it. The burgers weren't the best thing. Others got some of the sausages and hot dogs and they thought they were good. I also got the fried pickles. I love pickles, but they fry whole spears instead of slices and I think it was too much pickle and not enough breading. The customer service was ok. He came to check on us a few times before we got our food, but not so much after. We had to get up and refill our own drinks since he wasn't coming around. Not sure if we were supposed to or not. I think the place is worth a shot. They do have some good food and good flavors, but I don't think everything is great there so just go with whatever your gut tells you to try. I think I'll go back to try the pineapple sausage that I didn't get last time, but wish I would've over the burger.

BCXhq2vUNL5eGGUUQ28SuQ.text: I've been slipping on writing some Yelp reviews lately...I write so many papers for my major that often I don't feel like writing a creative accolade for the places that I do enjoy. But for Great Links, I'll make the exception.  When I was 17, I was having the time of my life running around Philly and Brooklyn.  I was on an extended vacation (months) visiting my relatives and was bouncing between the two cities. It was my first east coast experience, and it was incredible. What I remember the most was not the sights and the sounds, but it was the food. OMG the food...how I miss it.  Great Links is able to bring me a little slice of what I remember and loved most about Brooklyn and Philly. Another reviewer said it best: The moment you step inside the doors, you don't feel like you're in Vegas anymore. Suddenly you're in a casual, intimate little retro diner where you can place your order at the front, or grab a barstool at the counter and watch the cooks prepare your food. Heck, you're so close you could even chat with them - but I try not to, because they're busy cooking 20 things at once. For the east coast, these types of joints litter every street corner. For Vegas, it's not so common. It makes it all the more special.  Everyone there is really nice. The cooks/grillmasters are awesome and very talented - I can't seem to cook more than one thing at a time without burning it all on MY stove, so how they manage to do it so well is beyond me. They chat to the customers when they can, and make sure that you're doing ok. The servers are also friendly and attentive. I've even met the owner, and he's a very personable guy. And he works hard too, because I've watched him bus tables when it gets really busy. I've never seen a owner do dirty work at any other restaurant, so he has my respect.  The menu is extensive and delicious.The portions are huge and extremely affordable. They have more than hot dogs for those not in the mood, as well as salads for those of you that are a little more health-conscious (I am not one of those people). They have a breakfast menu that I'd like to try someday - if I can ever convince myself to wake up before noon on my days off.  In addition to the food, they have the usual soft drinks, milk shakes, malt beverages, bottled beer, and even some beer on tap. Never have tried a milkshake, because I usually get filled up on my entree, but they look good, and I am tempted.  During lunch rush hour, expect to wait a little bit longer for your food. This is not a slam against the restaurant - everything is prepared fresh, and it gets seriously busy. I don't mind waiting the extra few minutes for good food. I believe you can call ahead and place a to-go order - so if you're short on time and not dining in, this might be a better way to go.  I can't say enough good things. I am a happy customer, and I'm pretty picky about where I spend my money. I appreciate a place that serves good food and brings back happy memories of a long-time-ago.

oBoZXIai0ZfIyBH2E4uneQ.text: Getting a delicious beverage from Starbucks across the way, but needing some lunch and already happened to be craving some hot dogs... Brew House caught my eye.  Welp. uQ-Hj1FCQGC05647KbQH1Q.text: This was our third visit, normally a great place, but today we waited for our lunch order through three new customers who got their orders. Finally the owner came over & asked us what we'd like and we said we've been waiting & waiting, we gave our order to your partner already.  Don't know who this older guy was but he screwed up obviously. It looked like the waitresses didn't show up & the guys were running the place.  Hubs got mad, dropped a couple of bucks on the table & we left unfed.  What's sad about this is they lost about a $30 sale and two good customers who won't be back.  Food is good, service sucks.

A8gB0nGgTXkZ0cGtTBQrwQ.text: Being the only non-meat-eater in the house - I'm normally limited to salads, grilled cheese or fries when we go eat out for a quick lunch. This place was definitely a compromise with a great reward!   They will substitute any menu item that has meat in it with the vegetarian option of it (veggie chicken patty, burger patty, bacon, and chili)...they can also substitute turkey too.  The food the rest of the family had was enjoyed just as much...will definitely be back! Staff was great and place was clean.  The only thing I would recommend is that if your at a table where there is veggie and non-veggie orders being placed - order the veggie item first as there was a gap of about 10 minutes between the food coming out. (they do indicate on their menu that veggie items take a few minutes longer).

ztSUx49GKiVR5q7oXtOrEA.text: This place is awesome... Some of the best dogs I've had... A lot of different choices done up however you like... The Philly cheese is on a "whole notha level" as Key & Peele would say... One of my new favorites spots that feel familiar when you walk in...

pQ56tV7GsyNh--hJJHUOuw.text: I can't believe I ate here and didn't order a hot dog! I wasn't extremely hungry yet intrigued by the grill master fries mentioned in previous reviews. They were everything I had imagined and then some. The grilled onions were caramelized to perfection. The fries were fresh and crispy. The thousand Island dressing was tangy and sweet yet not overpowering. The melted cheese was the perfect amount not to smother the fries completely, I was in french fry heaven! The service was super friendly and fast. I will return to try more menu items!

F1xAFJlwmSq94C3TyivpQw.text: My kids and I went here to grab some take out just a couple days ago. The pro's- The Italian fries were tasty. Parmigian with garlic and a bit of oil. The chili cheeseburger was good....but here's the thing. The con's- shortly after we arrived there and placed our order, the manager and or owner was well within earshot, telling....yelling at one of his (former?) employees that he was "f'ing fired!". Extremely loud. The other employees seemed a bit shaken up, so maybe that explains the quality of our food. The chili cheese dog was ok. It seemed under cooked. Again, maybe  it was the situation.  Definitely willing to give this place another chance, seeing how favorably this place is reviewed....

-HUNGxeENGWEl18nCk6zgA.text: My brother came to visit from LA and he always uses Yelp... So he found this place and said there was good reviews and we would try it... We went and LOVED IT!! I have been back many times since. I just don't recommend going when they first open.

52gJGyXJA4gNngvkj1ufQQ.text: Perhaps my trip this restaurant was just a stray from the norm, or perhaps the people that review this place have never been to a quality burger and dog type place.   I gave this restaurant a fair shot and was excited based on Yelp reviews. Yelp rarely fails me but this was one of those times where it fell short of expectations.   Is there a good-ole-boy system at this place? All I heard the owner talking about was their award winning burgers to whom I supposed are the regulars. My wife, daughter and I were the only people under the age of 50 there, so perhaps that explains why their food was so bland and flavorless.   I ordered the pastrami, which was cooked really well. However, there was little taste. I have tried pastrami from dozens of restaurants and this was bottom-of-the-barrell in terms of taste.   My wife ordered grilled cheese, which is impossible to screw up unless you're 4 years old or completely inept. It was solid, but she ordered it with bacon and bacon saves everything. The bread was alright, but seemed store-bought.   My daughter ordered chicken nuggets and she said they were disgusting. I looked at them and they appeared to be the type you buy from a frozen food section.   We shared fries, which apparently do not come with any sort of salt or seasoning.   To be fair, the waitresses there were super friendly and on top of their game. I hope the owner realizes this and recognizes them accordingly.   What I found off-putting on a personal level was that the owner came out and greeted every single table, asked about their experience and bragged about their food.... except for our table. He also missed a kid run into the restaurant, grab two soda cups, fill them and leave without paying. All because he was too busy bragging about his food to the NASCAR crowd that was infesting this place.   One of the cooks also took the time to venture into the diner and talk about the burger competition they had previously won. he oddly went out of his way to state that "I don't think they'll want us back next year. Not that we're cheating but..." and I didn't catch the end.   Overall, I was pretty disappointed with this place considering the positive reviews on yelp. I will eventually give this place another chance to redeem itself and, if it isn't able to, I'll suspect that they are asking friends and family to circumvent the yelp reviews.   Either that or they rarely get anyone who isn't an AARP member and can actually handle salt and seasoning.

VFL5laL9YUr8CTZ25ZYrxA.text: My whole family and I love this place! You walk in sit whenever you'd like or you can make a Togo order. The staff is always friendly and accommodating. They have old 6 packs on the table that house their condiments and hold up their paper menus. This is a very laid back no frills place which is great when you just want to be casual. I always order the Chicago dog with a hot link and the clam strips with wasabi ranch so awesome! This is a family owned place so you will see pretty much the same faces everytime you come in. They have beer on draft and even RootBeer on draft! If you haven't been I suggest you go! Love this place!

TLZ4Qp3CqfMorJJKG6qefw.text: This. Place. Rocks. We went there last Saturday after a trying week drove us to junk food and movies. We are Vegan, so finding places to eat out was a challenge. HappyCow.net had them listed, and we were stoked they were right up the street. Complete with a hearty vegan selection in addition to their carnivore options, the menu was lookin' pretty svelte for one who intends to smash food in their face without regret. This is the kind of neighborhood place you go to not be prissy pants, to chat with the cook and waitress, to just eat till your fat and happy. I had the vegetarian Chicago dog and the husband had the vegetarian Italian sausage. Oh... man... it was so good we finished our dogs before our fries and zucchini sticks came out of the fryer. Great Links is a Great Option for blended friends and families! (some vegan, some vegetarian, some carnivore)

mP3WF6yCXWR9F2Q6aHVlnw.text: I'm big on first impressions and I was over impressed! Their dogs and links are amazing. An to top it off we accidently left a retainer there it was on a napkin and they had it already put up before I called them!! Great customer service I will definetly become a regular here!

AiVVJ91M1ftFJ80cImAJrQ.text: Friendly staff , from the Italian sausage sandwich to the phillys was amazing :) make sure you try the fry sauce

F2doPWNbiJvUfaiQ_tJpSQ.text: Delicious! I have been here several times and tried both burgers and dogs they offer. My favorite thus far is their Vegas Chili Dog. It is smothered in their white sage chili which is unique and delicious! They offer many varieties of beer and a delicious root beer float to settle that sweet tooth. Staff is delightful and it's a fun casual environment.

jRi1MMWHS54Yp8cTKZb7Qg.text: You know what's funny about this place?  It is bacically a fast food diner place.  Something where you just expect some good greasy food in a no frills atmosphere.   But, I got a little of the opposite.  Please let me explain.  So if you went to a fancy place you are paying for good food, but you are paying for the "sizzle in the steak."  You are paying for the atmosphere.  In a diner like this you are paying for good simple food done right.  No frills.  Even thought this place is not a fancy place - you are kinda paying to get a cool diner style low key joint with some good ol'fashioned diner style food.  This place does have an appeal.  A hominess.  It has a personality, and it is personable.  It is a happy place.  This really does add to the appeal.  The food.  Well, it was good.  The BLT had plenty of thick cut bacon.  The chili cheese fries were smothered and the cheese was melty.  The Italian beef had plenty of beef.  The Au Jus was good.  If you like good food off the grill... this is the place.  In the "something different" challenged northwest part of the valley this is a place worth a visit.  The only complaint was the Italian Beef bun was mushy... not wet... it was mushy.   "I hope this makes sense."

Just rude  and piss poor customer service, sucks because I heard the food was good too...oh well.

X7DZVuQrIEalMLCUTMFvEg.text: Love this place. Great hot dogs and sausages. I recommend trying the Grillmaster Fries.

14yyu96F83CfX7rnw6PAhw.text: Wow I was in the mood for a hot dog since Tuesday & it's Wednesday. My other half found me a hot dog house. Had the Streets of New York Dog. Spicy Mustard, Red onion sauce & sauerkraut. Excellent. Reminds me of the hot dogs in a cart in New Jersey. I also ordered the Jalapeno Poppers which were stuffed with cream cheese. Good but I prefer the cheese in them. Excellent meal very stuffed

5aTOMaMIjILPz03dE_p9Yw.text: By far one of the best hot dog places I've ever been too. The service is great the staff is friendly and the facility is very clean with a great atmosphere. They have 2 TVs going with sports. They have draft beer for you beer drinkers out there. I got one chilly cheese hot dog with one plain hot dog and crinkle cutt fries. They also serve other foods like hamburgers, chicken and chicken sandwiches, and they have hit and cold sandwiches as well they have a lil bit of everything for everybod... I would recommend this place to anyone in the area to come here... this is a must go to place I and I will definitely be coming back here even if I'm not in the area

photos.caption: Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilli cheese dog, plain hot dog with crinkle cutt fries

xtxz1-kEXceZiuXO-25LCQ.text: This a great little hot dog joint... they also make a good burger! I was surprised that they offer a wide variety of other items as well. Their menu is pretty big with an option for all. They have delicious cold root beer on tap, and the service is excellent!   We had our 4yr old niece with us and she was treated like royalty while we ate at the counter. She enjoyed the smaller burger, fries, fries pickles, and fried clams... the staff was astonished at how much she could eat.  Hubby was able to watch the game on the big screen while enjoying his kraut dog and burger. Overall, the staff was great, food was great, and the dining room has a place for everyone! I highly recommend this place... and we'll definitely be back!

WuOAV1490US0aTBNic81tA.text: If you are craving greasy/oily, sloppy, fatty food come here! lol My bf loves this place and its actually good, I just feel bad coming here since I'm always trying to keep count of calories. Anyways, they have a huge menu with a lot to choose from.  Not pricey at all with decent size portions.  KUDOS to the older man that was working his butt off in the kitchen last Saturday morning, when it got super busy.

iDSt4BScJ9btwruhK1Et1Q.text: Wow! What a great place to pop in for a delicious hotdog and the BEST natural cut fries in town! The place has a nice vibe. A little busy, loud, and maze like. But in a good way. It's hard to explain, so you should just check it out!

LJj21MuAjeBi0ba3sGsAjg.text: Super upset.  We come her all the time as we want to go to local business when possible. But tonight came in 25 min before closing and was treated so horribly.  I'm actually so upset as being a long time guest. We walked in and the cook threw forks on the counter clearly annoyed and then the waitress/hostess told us she was closing up and if we "really"wanted to we could get food to go.  So we left and went to eat somewhere else. Truly disappointed. I get it was close to closing but you weren't closed and shouldn't have treated us so poorly. Business lost. I'm sure the owners appreciate that.!!!!

w4ZnbCrb6r0NED9rZswiPA.text: Deafening gotta get the hot dog with a hoagie bun very shockingly amazing outstanding service death and will be going back again to try more for food menu items

1jjM9Bm9l7dgYLJz9ARq7Q.text: I've been here a couple of times and I'd definitely say they sure know how to make some good quality food.   I've ordered their garlic sausage in the streets of New York style as well with some garlic Parmesan tater tots. And I have to say that's definitely my go to whenever I'm there.   This place also has a wide selection of not only hot dogs- but also sandwiches and burgers which is definitely a plus. I've taken my dad here and he's not so much a big fan of hot dogs but did order the Reuben and loved it just as much.   Customer service was great as well. The waiter was always super accommodating and seemed to know the menu well. They also have no problem with to go orders, and the wait time for those usually isn't too bad. So if you're looking for a place with great food for a decent price I'd definitely recommend

uKTVd5wOO0kYYxzfP8Ly2g.text: I CANNOT BELIEVE this is my first time here. This place reminded me of an amazing hole in the wall place in Oakland, CA. I ordered the Master Grilled fries and the Hot Italian. Oh and two large bud lights.  The bud lights were crisp and cold. They had a wonderful ratio of bubbles to head and that mysterious aftertaste that only an American beer drinker appreciates.  The fries were so yummy I could not stop comparing them to the In N Out animal style fries. With one exception, these are far yummier! (Is that a word?) Yeah, they were greasy,but, greasy GOOD!!!!! The hot dog was nice and the grilled onions were DELICIOUS, but hardly any peppers.  All is forgiven, this place is a cute little spot for a well worth lunch or for a casual date. I cannot wait to bring the family here as it would brighten everyone's day. My bill came to $21.00 and I consider it a good value. I looked at the menu and I am calculating that for two adults and two teens it comes to under $50 with/out tip.

photos.caption: Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bud light, cold and bubbly.

AFmYI2uAu2dzYOBQc4Z1Rw.text: Hubby and I wanted to try a new to us spot for dinner on Saturday. I read the reviews for this place and decided to give it a try. I wish I had picked my other choice.   Although the food was good, the service and the atmosphere was terrible.   I had the Chicago dog (minus onions), hubby had the fish and chips, and we shared the fried pickles. The pickles address spicy pickles that are beer battered. They were okay, but their ranch that was served with it was terrible! The fish was okay and the fries were perfectly crisp. The best thing was the hot dog.   Our server kept disappearing and we had to get our own refills on our drinks. The tables were not clean, and the paper menus left us both feeling gross after touching them.   I'd recommend other places before this one.

9kpA7vcs0y1l3ijY-OBrIw.text: Amazing food, great prices, and cool atmosphere! Mike provided exceptional service and my family and I thoroughly enjoyed our dinner. Definitely recommend!

UuaH-oXsuQ63y6cjuRrB_g.text: Holy hot dog! I am pretty simple or extravagant so I go all the way with things or pretty simple. First time around I ordered cheddar fries and the regular All-American hotdog. The hotdog was crispy on the outside and soft and flavorful in the inside, there's not much to say about a hotdog but this one is pretty damn good. I've had hotdogs in Chicago, and they were not this good. Apparently these hotdogs come from San Francisco and are flown in, that's it for me. The cheddar fries were delicious it's basically a bunch of crispy fries topped off with milk tea and salty cheese. Definitely going to come back with the family when I have time, location is out of my way, but that's OK.

8ONymvczMu3WxeISjjku1w.text: Great little place with friendly staff and great food. Be aware, seating is very limited. I'm sure we'll be returning, just hope we can find a table.

7wMJF55v-aspCvR8fjqsoQ.text: Great food terrible service.  Elizabeth is horrible. She never listens when we place our order she's served us 3 times and every time something is wrong. I could understand the mix up if they were busy but they weren't. She doesn't do check backs with us so we have to finish our food without a drink refill while she sits around.

kXWHxkwxNUtMipT1VCyGkA.text: Finally stopped in and tried this place out. I live within walking distance of it and never thought of eating there. Man, let me tell you! I was surprised by the vast amount of items they had to offer. For such a small, but decently sized place. It was very old diner and var feel. Like NY almost. Sports were playing kn the TVs. They had a full beer selection. After spending 20 minutes trying to figure out what I wanted? I finally had their "Chicken Ceasar Salad Sandwich"(of all things). But, it was super tasty! I also ordered their "Buffalo Cheese Tater Tots" extra crunchy and mild! Oh, man! I could have eaten just that. My step daughter order a Classic Grilled Cheese and an Oreo Milkshake. It didn't disappoint! Our serve Julian was super attentive and funny. Loved how fast the service was and how fresh the food tasted. Also the prices are very very reasonable! We will definitely be back for more items!

judvKTXu4LVZmG6mTAntOQ.text: 2/28/2019  Saw this place on Yelp and I wanted to give them a try as I love Coney's.   The place was busy and I found a seat at the counter.  I was waited on by a friendly person who took my order.  I ordered the standard Chili Cheese Dog going easy on the onion and a Diet Coke and the crinkly fries.  My order came out in a reasonably time and it was as I ordered.  The Chili seemed to be the standard chili you get that is canned and similar to Wiener schnitzel or Coney Islanders.  It did taste good, although I usually will not eat the canned Chili.  The fries were fresh and hot but did not seem to be cooked all the way through.  After eating the Chili Dog, I ordered the Cajun Hot Link with onions and peppers.  It was really good.  The cook was very busy and I was impressed all the different things he did while cooking several orders at a time.  The wait staff was friendly and made sure that my needs were met.  I would recommend this place for quick, good food and friendly service.

1WrqbzXJnL1qmOXF96bIhg.text: We visit here at least twice a month. Great food and great service! Highly recommended plus a family owned restaurant. Try the root beer!

elWWxyrceGxpqHR8YhrNhg.text: Went to this restaurant on my lunch break since a friend had recommended it to me. I was not disappointed at all! Sat down, placed my order and it was cooked right in front of me. I went with the philly griller dog and a side of italian fries. The griller dog was very good. The italian fries can use less parmesan cheese on them but thats just my personal taste so not taking a star away. The staff was real friendly and ready to refill my drink when needed. Food is cooked to order so don't expect fast food. Will definitely be back soon to try one of their other menu items.

ujZIp1J4E9F5_nAz43gI8w.text: I was lucky enough to check this place out when I was in the area for a doctors appointment. Wow! Talk about tasty artery clogging food! Leave your calorie and carb counting at the door this place is worth it!  They use Boars Head brand hot dogs. They are the perfect start to all their hot dogs and they have tons of them anyway you can think of. They also have tons if burgers and fry options. It was very hard to pick what we wanted because everything sounded good!! We both choose the Philly dog with cheese sauce. Joel ordered the mushroom and Swiss burger. Of course we had to pick cheese fries and onion rings. I ordered a whole dill pickle, but they were out. They were super apologetic about it and instead gave me pickle spears for free! The food was excellent and messy! Be prepared to use ALL the napkins! The hot dogs had a snap to them and could totally be eaten with a fork and knife. The fries were crisp as were the onion rings. Great Links even offers fry sauce. Joel's burger was also tasty and moist. Perfectly cooked too! ( It's hard to get a perfect medium burger sometimes.) We both left so full.   I wish they were closer to us, but Great Links is totally worth the drive. If you have the serious munchies this is your spot! Their menu is huge and reasonably priced. Plus they have cheese sauce!!! You can't go wrong with that!!!

Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion rings with fry sauce
Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom &amp; Swiss burger

bDFgN5zTcTVOz3pAKGG-lg.text: I've eaten here several times and have always had a dog or a brat and have never been disappointed. I love to sit at the bar and watch the grill team work. They are in perfect synch...one guy on the grill, another on fries and a third expediting. And the taste is dynamite. They range from classic combinations to interesting. They also have burgers and boast of being top rated in Vegas by Fox News. So, I had one. It was good, but not great. The burgers alone wouldn't bring me back....but the Dogs...Heck Yes!

ECYU2Kec0IdEV0sQnDiPyw.text: I really wish I would have liked this place more, especially because I was super excited to finally try it. Actually, when I first walked in, I kind of fell in love. The atmosphere is relaxed and our server was super friendly, gave us time and answered any questions we had.   We ordered the Chicago and the Las Vegas hot dog with the natural Italian fries on the side. The fries came out first and unfortunately they were just ok. Too much parmesan cheese, too salty and too fatty and they got soggy very quick. The hot dogs were ok, almost too much of everything in my opinion.   Then, as soon as we walked out of this place, I ended up having an upset stomach that lasted all day. But this also could be due to me eating generally organic and healthy and perhaps my body doesn't like fatty food anymore. My husband was ok and he ate the same as I did, so I don't think the meat was bad. Regardless, I didn't like it enough to go back any time soon, but if I did, I think I would stay away from all the loaded hot dogs and try a simple one or get a sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

65oiVr_zHOM1ajTBGjwjHg.text: Came here tonight w my husband. I couldn't eat anything there because of how disgusted I was with some serious hygiene concerns:  1. Started off with a dirty chair - crumbs and drips of liquid- no big deal, I understand. I asked the waitress wipe it down which she happily did, yet for the fact she only wiped down half if the chair..... Oh well I am hungry, I will sit in the still wet chair with unknown liquid....  2. Saw the cook with his gloves on wipe his nose with his gloves. Like a strong finger length swipe of the nostril.  He didn't change his gloves after that. His gloves were also clearly moistened so you can tell that his hands were sweating under the gloves which makes me wonder, how long have those gloves been on?   3. Next a different cook comes out into the dining room with gloves on again- gets himself a drink of water. I can clearly can see water drips through them. He then takes a napkin to his nose and wipes- does not change gloves. Then this guy tries to take our order, same gloves - pointing at the menu what are the featured items, giving me a closer view of the gloves to confirm, yes your hands are sweating bullets under these gloves which appear to have been on for at least 3 hours...  This guy was really nice and the food sounded awesome but the more and more I had to witness this weird Glove phenomenon.... I couldn't even order. Who wears gloves in the dining room of a restaurant????  My husband got his food to go, but I am pregnant and after viewing everyone w gloves on and wiping noses, getting personal drinks, taking orders, even flipping through a magazine, and then apparently not changing gloves - too much for me to risk a food borne illness or any other germ.  Really sucks the menu looked great too. Everyone was nice, it was just so awkward and the most disturbing thing is that these folks seemed to act like it was no big deal to not change gloves, which makes me wonder goes on behind the scenes in terms of cleanliness.  Sorry for the negative review but just had to share this and hopefully management will use this to improve.

YbHL9UWaT2i_9Brb1NVxhQ.text: Delicious! Vast menu. Nice beer selection. Service was fast. Everything was cooked fresh right in front of us. friendly staff. bathrooms were immaculate. Fun atmosphere. Would recommend to anyone!

MMmcnG1L3sxRS0M0WzomCg.text: I love how their hot dogs snap when you bite into them.  The hot links are equally delicious with the peppers, onions and mustard.  Oh...and the burgers are top notch too!  Don't miss the crinkle cut fries with hot sauce and gobs of melted cheddar cheese.  Lastly, you'll need a hand scooped shake to wash it all down.  This place is the True Heart Attack Grill.

HJn0dxx7D6pBKtVf9s0-ZQ.text: One of my favorite places in Vegas. I'd eat here daily if I could. The fries are amazing, the bratwurst and Italian sausage is to die for! I always get mob boss style. Sooo good. I go here all the time when I'm in Vegas and thankfully I'm moving back soon. This place and Monta are my favorite places in the city.

photos.caption: Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dudeeee.

722lJ1icfwdGgNba-51jnA.text: As first timers we looked forward to trying this place out. We didn't realize that we'd have to know beforehand exactly what we wanted to eat and that we should refrain from looking over the whole menu to choose what we wanted. The server was an impatient jerk who made it blatantly clear that we were inconveniencing him in some way. He appeared annoyed and rushed us making us feel a little stupid that we didn't know we were supposed to know what type of fries we wanted. If we had a nickel for every sigh he made during our order, it would've paid for dinner. If it weren't for having a hungry child in tow, we would have walked out midorder. To top it off, this gem of a server had the same blue rubber gloves on that he used to handle food with during the order. The same ones he had on during check out for other people and the same ones he brought soda with. Not the cleanest. Other patrons expressed the same annoyance to this guy's demeanor. Who knows why he was such a jerk.  Food was ho hum, especially since we felt so unwelcomed and rushed at 6pm on a Monday night. Not as we had anticipated at all. Horrible experience. Plus side, there was a kids menu. Will never go back or recommend to anyone.

qCV-W4DmjY5m-Z5SXknzjw.text: You can actually see how they grill because it's not hidden. Very fast service, makes you feel at home. Sometimes those hole in the wall spots are the best. Try the Ortega burger its so delicious.

MMEY8z7E0cYOZfkoHJUdvw.text: Service was phenomenal ! The staff check on us periodically but not to the point where it was annoying. Their food is amazingly good! It has a very authentic taste, I love their cheese sticks they are out of this world good ! I had a hotdog with a spicy link New York style and it did not disappoint. Great place to come eat! And great staff.

PwviAPjl167slHWg9d4vUw.text: The wife and I had a taste for a good dog. We decided on Great Links. I've never eaten there but the wife has used their takeout. I love a good dog and I wasn't disappointed. The wife had the  Louisiana Hot Link and I had my favorite the Chicago Dog. It was an excellent choice. Both were delicious. I was blown away that the fries stayed hot for the whole meal. Service was great. The young lady was on top of her game. I plan on eating there a lot. I will not go to another place for my Hot Dogs.

_JEEALNp6-bLKBxLukPQzw.text: This place rocks.  Come for the fresh cut fries and stay for the pastrami topped cheese burger. . Everyone left full and happy.   Don't forget to try the Italian fries.  That garlic butter is dangerously good.

FWk-whJIYrEFtXmqc_teeg.text: I had high hopes for this place but was definitely disappointed. The natural cut fries were so soggy and definitely greasy. Added chili and it seeped through the paper. The only reason I finished them is because I was absolutely starving. My dad for a meatball sub, which looked average. I got a Chicago dog without a bun. It was wrinkly and looked like it had been sitting. I ordered my son a kids meal; hot dog with no bun. It came with a bun. He's allergic to gluten. His shoestring fries were better than ours (not greasy) and his hotdog looked better than mine too- bigger and sans wrinkles. The waitress was friendly though and even though it's a small venue, it's comfortable to be in. I may come back if we are in a pinch. It wasn't awful but it definitely was NOT good either.... Oh and did I mention our table was dirty too and it never got cleaned off? My dad actually had to remove a leftover plate. Kinda gross.

u4qeIIdBJLeTXmGIyvWT_A.text: The food is worth 4 stars, service is worth 2.   I've been a couple of times recently and they are consistently understaffed...which leads to long wait times to place or pick up a to-go order, and slow service when you dine in. Their main waitress seems too busy and stressed, and the owner really needs to bring on another person during the lunch rush or else risk losing business.   As for the food- the Italian fries are so good! Make sure to get them with the skinny fries (the crinkle fries are too fat and never really seem crispy), and their fry sauce. My husband loved his Las Vegas Chili Dog, and they do a great Chicago Dog. If they give their staff some help and bring on another server we'd be back more often.

2PKLrh_B08YhJ13FQOLUcQ.text: Wife and I love this place! Some of the best food around and the best service with faces that are always familiar. Gotta love small business with the right attitude! We'll come here as long as you guys are here!!!

9h75AaXUdRkF5cfQh6n_0w.text: Staff: very busy but nice.  Food: - I ordered the Ball Field Dog and French fries, The buns were very soggy, the dog was very hard and tasted weird. The fries were greasy....  - My friend ordered a veggie dog, it was very dry....  I got sick couple hours later ( I have a sensitive stomach though...)  Not my type of hot dogs...never again.  I think even weinersnitchel tastes better...  Yelpers, I don't understand the 4 stars...  As I said, the staff was busy but polite....

Es_NfRy5p7zoQDYDwAQDBw.text: Yuuummm! The Philly steak and zuccini fries - so good!  I guess they recently changed hours - yelp has them open until 9 but when we got there on Tuesday at 8:25 we were told they closed at 8:30. They were nice enough to make our food even though I felt bad standing there while they cleaned up.  BTW - they close at 8 on Mondays. I will be back - earlier.

OkVzxq0N4SRTrVglOhKgxw.text: This hole in the wall place caught my eye and I am glad that I took a chance and tried it.  I am a big fan of burgers, but I don't eat them very often.  This casual place in a strip mall next to Lowes and Qdoba at Craig and Rancho has amazing food.    This place was full at dinner time on a Friday night, and many of the customers seemed to be regulars.  I ordered the Ortega Bacon Cheese Burger (the name might be a little different, not sure) and it was great.  I did sub swiss for the pepper jack, and the result was a little less heat than I would have liked, but that's my fault. It was still delicious, with high quality ingredients.    The shoestring fries were hot and fresh and one order is more than enough for two people.  Try it with one of their fry sauces.  I can't wait to go back and try one of their hot dogs, which they have made for them by Boar's Head.     Two soft drinks, one order of fries, one burger and one cheesesteak cost about $19 before the tip.  The service very good, and they were prompt with refills.     It is not a dive, but it is definitely a place where you will find people in flip flops and shorts.

8MZJ6qarfX07ZB8nMpqyBw.text: First off great customer service. This is a small establishment with a lot to offer. Their focus is hot dogs and beer, but they also offer sausages, hamburgers and hot sandwiches. We enjoyed the Chicago dog, Parmesan French fries and the Italian beef hot sandwich which were all excellent. Worth mentioning was the homemade raspberry tea and the 10% military discount.   I will absolutely be returning here for lunch!

3rCGeNU3NTnZ2D_kuRH9eg.text: Absolutely amazing food!!! Reminds me of a family bbq. I always get a cheese burger with the hand cut fries! Sooo delicious

ceTtfq1kxaL4Wxvj3il2Ug.text: BEWARE... Though it appears in the '19 and the '20 Entertainment Books,  this establishment WILL NOT HONOR the coupons!   Plus, their advertisement states that they use Boar's Head Hot Dogs....they DO NOT!  They use some offbrand called Evergood.  My wife and I stopped in there for lunch.  We sat down to eat and though they were not busy, it took like 10 minutes until a waitress found the time to stop by. We did eat and I will tell you, the experience, and the food were not satisfying. (I use that term so as not to get in trouble.) So, to all whom may venture in,. Caveat Emptor...(buyer beware)

vj_dr1XtVNLJzSua1MlAdw.text: This is our hidden greasy spoon. Great food and only about 10 tables and a few counter seats. It is always crowded as well. We come here fairly frequently.  I would give it 5 stars but the sun beating through the front glass this time of year is brutal. The shades just aren't enough.

oWdwMGeRIUEC2IjNRfOlhw.text: Came in ordered 1 Hot Italian Sausage with peppers/onions and some hot mustard. 2 Regular American Dogs. We got a soda and a water.. the water was tap water but in all honesty, the worst water i ever drank. I tasted like a old sewer that had water that didn't move for weeks. So bad in fact I drank straight up Tabasco sauce just to get the taste out. I have had lots of unfiltered tap from little mom and pop shops but this was at a level I cant believe someone didn't notice in upper management or anyone with a sense of taste.  There were 6 tables with a total of 11 customers while I waited 27 minutes for 2 dogs and a sausage to get to the table. Why am i weird and know the number of people... because after 15 minutes I started keeping track of the nothing that the employees were doing.  At one point some dude who couldn't read or understand the order machine tried cooking but got lost in analyzing the screen.. he then was basically like F this.. and went and talked to this broke trick customer who was like 350 and had daisy dukes on .. but hey its Vegas .. at least she wasn't homeless am i right ?!. Him and this other younger employee talked about while one was watching TV and the other trying to impress the fatty with his hot dog job. Then suddenly some Speedy Gonzalez older Mexican man came out and made the hot dogs and brought them to my table. He forgot the hot mustard.. no big deal though.  I complain because I come from a place that had many hot dogs stands/restaurants such as Teds Famous Hot Dogs.. these places are known for wrapped lines and they pump out food faster and at a way higher standard than this Great Links place. And yes they also do burgers and fried foods. Also for Great Links being a hot dog/burger place.. had zero smell of cooking food.. mainly because they are using flat grills instead of going quality and charcoal and flame grilling like good hot dogs places are known for.But I should smell dogs and its should attract my sense of smell. Instead it smells like bathroom cleaner and random bath and body works from other people. I understand that western United States doesn't really have a great food game that isn't Mexican/Asian.. but hot dogs are quick cheap food that shouldn't ever take 27 minutes to make.  Overall hot dogs were 3/5 (they had a nice snap).. Italian Sausage 2/5 (mealy bun, and no cracking split skin from a nice cook) and service was a 1/5. (slow service with employees who are not working in a damn, our waitress never checked how things were after taking order and delivering first drinks. We didn't get refills and i didn't get a different  drink because she never came back.

CGIKtCEJCZqS4Ruppi7inQ.text: came today ... server didnt want to take my order.... but took everyone elses at my table... then never put my order in and when my party was done eating i got my food. What a bitch. Never again at this place if she is working with her yoga pants and nose ring i will go else where. I dislike her and she should not be a server to anyone

_fRzd2ThWfNecDWybRpplw.text: I was hungry and in the area.   When you walk in, you find seating then your waited on.   I checked out the menu saw they had pastrami sandwiches, so you know that was an OF COURSE on rye.  Plus I got the shoestring fries with their fry sauce. I asked for hot tea, they don't have that,  I think that request may have even brought about confusion. So I opted for ice tea, with lemon. There wasn't any sweetener.  The fries came out first, I enjoyed the sauce. Then after came the sandwich. Portions were decent for the price.   There is ample table seating, plus bar seating. They had games going on the televisions.  Location is Craig/ Jones - ample parking

Nt7oSTQzHYsJh4RU71c2Jg.text: Went there today and got sick. I had a hot dog with sauerkraut and fries. The fries were soggy. I think it was the sauerkraut that made me sick. Sucks because I have tickets to a live performance tonight and I don't think I'll be able to go. It's now the next day, Sunday the 25th, and my wife also got sick last night. She just had a plain hotdog and tater tots. Looking back I think it may have been the ketchup as we had a window seat and that ketchup bottle may have been fermenting in the sun. I had some blonde kid as my server and he seemed like he didn't want to be there. Asked him to bring me some sweet onion dipping sauce and he never did. Overall the meal just was not good. The fries were soggy and limp, the hotdog was soggy and just a mess. Can't believe I tipped for that.

RSBTKwAjewzD5NNGGZ9hDQ.text: My daughter and I visited this establishment and I must say we will return. The food was amazing. There's nothing like fresh cut fries and the amount of topping choices they have can satisfy anyone's palate.. In addition to the amazing food, a wonderful couple paid for our food but didn't let the waitress tell me until they left..I would have definitely stopped them.... Whoever you are I want to thank you for your amazing act of kindness.. I'm definitely going to pay your act of kindness forward...

9a-yd3yeSA60E6xgsIXAnA.text: Vegetarian Dog  My friend has been raving about this brew-house and their phenomenal vegetarian alternatives! I ordered a Mob Boss style brat that ended up being sold out and settled for the hot-dog. The hot dog was amazingly delicious and the fresh onions mushroom and peppers took the experience over the top. Generous size dog with two mozzarella sticks (requested on the side instead of on top). The Italian fries were pretty good as well.    The young blonde at the register is such an expert in her role, regrettably she assumed I knew everything about the menu as well as she did. I expressed it was my first time but that didn't seem to matter! I'll be more prepared next visit. Oh yeah I'll be back!  $5.29 Mob Boss $4.59 Italian Fries

vjISTJ7v9aAsiBcd_Fgp4A.text: Glad we found this little gem! We've been looking for a place with good burgers and chili cheese fries cause Tommy's wasn't cutting it. We ordered the pastrami sandwich, quarter pounder and chili cheese fries. They were big portions and everything was fresh and tasted so good. Service was quick, and our total was about 24 dollars for all our food and drinks. Will definitely come again.

YUDeFljIYkYlRtTUhWvUGA.text: Once again a great, quick dinner!! Tonight we had  a Chicago dog, cheese dog and fried zucchini!! So many choices it was hard to decide. We enjoyed our dinner and got to watch some college football. We love coming here!!

OkeR_4xOuE3vGT-DBJt5HQ.text: Ordered the fish-and-chips. Got the worst greasiest fries I've ever had from a restaurant. The fish was a decent size but the breading was, surprise, a bit greasy. Over all rather mediocre. Won't be going back.

u_2EE5YS8iKRkLBxFl5zuw.text: Awesome little hot dog resturant on the north end of town!   I went with the Philly cheese steak. It came on a warm bun with smothered onions, mushrooms, and provolone cheese. Packed with flavor galore. On the side I ended up going with the tater tots which came out crisp and perfectly salted however I would like to try these shoestring potatoes next time I come here.  The service here was top notch all around. The waitress helped me navigate the menu as there was soooooo many hot dogs on the menu that looked delish.  Can't wait to try some of the other sandwiches on the menu.

gHOQKRkoEazQIZFjQYkTmw.text: Damnnnnn this was some good food!! I gotta come back to try more off the menu!! Flat grill is perfectly seasoned!! Everything that came off it was magical!! J3GsBmndV0sVTATxKFUYiw.text: Lots of options for vegans/vegetarians. Friendly servers and great food. I recommend the grill master fries good stuff!

CviWCr-5zpEZTw_OeIxM9A.text: I have never had a bad hotdog here. I like that you can change the dogs and toppings to what ever you want.

bwjYI9cvz64Ntmilh-iiyA.text: Had me the New York Street dog and a Chicago dog, they're both very good, but the New York Street dog was absolutely outstanding, a must-have! Atmosphere and service was great. beers too. Tap Beer could have been a little colder, but it was still good. I saw some negative reviews about service, don't know where it comes from. Great spot for some great food. Will be returning.
