Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York Street dog, absolutely outstanding.

eu-ZZSEKOWDwPIcTTMvBHA.text: Regrettably, I will not be returning here. The hot dog was delicious, but everything else trumped the dog and therefore, It will hot be a win for me.  I was here a few weeks ago and got great tasting hot dog. Service was mediocre so I figured I would go again today because perhaps they had a bad hair day 2 weeks ago.  I went in for lunch and the observed 4 employees. A girl came over and immediately took my order.  She was friendly for the most part but that's the last I saw of her for a long time. About 10 minutes after ordering a hot dog and their "fresh-cut" fries, someone quickly drops the fries on my table I said, "thank you" and he didn't respond. He also, didn't tell me as to how much longer I would have to wait. I waited another 15 minutes or so and finally someone else dropped the hot dog. Again, I said, "thank you" and received no response. Nobody came by through the duration of my meal to check on me. When I was practically finished, the girl asked how everything was, and I said that I forgot to ask for pickles. She said, "I'm sorry."  The correct response would have been to offer to bring me some more pickles.  Additionally, the fresh cut fries were gross.  Because nobody checked on me sooner, I was unable to let them know so they can give me shoestring fries instead.  During my meal, I observed the third employee also, not respond to people when he dropped food at their table.  A simple, "you're welcome, I hope that you enjoy your meal" would have been an appropriate response.    Fortunately, when it was time to pay, the girl charged me incorrectly which I benefited from.  Finally I was thanked for coming by the girl.  I will not be returning here until new management or a new owner takes over that instills customer service onto their staff.

qeSs_hVWEeZX_KEJdBoaQQ.text: These people are KILLING the hot dog and sausage game! Everything was on point! I dont eat red meats or pork and was so excited to see a vegetarian Selection! I ordered the chicken philly and was so pleased with how it tasted..considering its not "real" meat.  My boyfriend inhaled both his hotdogs  (beef) Chicago and NY street dog. Lisa was our server..great customer service and very attentive to her duties as well as the grill chef (we sat at the bar). The menu is filled with variety so there's something for everybody!  Prices are great to! Wonderful first impression..definitely will be a returning customer!

photos.caption: Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Philly from the &#34;Vegetarian Selection&#34; menu.

grCv84-tQUP6xRN7R7yLbA.text: We were in the area and after doing some research on yelp. We made our way here (because Red Robin wasn't open yet). I had the grilled chicken mushroom sandwich $6.99 and an order of small crinkle cut fries $1.99. The sandwich was a little salty. Fries were golden and crispy. BF order 1/2 burger $6.99 and regular fries $2.99. The food was alright.

photos.caption: Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. grilled mushroom w/ Swiss chicken sandwich and crinkle cut fries.

vQFTosqFL_yHHwbcIaflAw.text: Had the hot dog with sauerkraut and chili cheese fries, both delicious! Will come back with the kiddos. Only thing is....the place is a little small and not much seating. So lunch time is busy.

C1TV57Gc4dsmMbuRkuhWjg.text: The food was made to order, nice and hot when I got it. Despite my food being loaded w great dressings it still looked nice and tastes even better. The staff was very courteous and extremely helpful when telling me about the menu. Awesome place to eat at!

_MkzZbyYD2xtJJV-eMLeTQ.text: I really, really, really wanted a hotdog, after googling a few local places, my hunny brought me here. The selection was awesome and since everything is a la carte, you aren't locked into a combo meal you don't really want. We shared a small shoestring fry and each got two dogs, a plain and a specialty.   The hotdogs themselves are great, they pop in your mouth, are juicy and full of flavor. I chose the deluxe chili dog which is basically a standard chili dog plus bacon, onion, jalapenos and a literal fistful of shredded cheese. I'm super picky about chili, can't stand it if it's soupy or greasy or overly spicy for no reason. I wasn't disappointed, everything about it was delicous. My hunny picked the Las Vegas chili dog, and I can honestly say, it was basically a flavor explosion on a bun.   My order was misread and delivered wrong at first, but the cook not only insisted on fixing it, did so in record time. The server was nothing but helpful, the overall service was great.  If the order had come out correctly the first time, this would be a solid five star review, as it is, I'd honestly say it's more of a 4.5 than a 4. If want a hotdog but wanna have it be better than pretty much anything you could make at home for a reasonable price, this is your place.   I can't even wait to try the sausage selection.

UognWMVbjhI5nT0kt8_OsQ.text: Found this little gem via Yelp. Hankering for a Chicago dog. Small restaurant, diverse selection and yummy food!!  Try the root beer on draft too!

_tEYrH40nJfL04lpQL_Ccg.text: How can you say no to this masterpiece "OLD WEST BURGER"?? This was delicious! I highly recommend!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old west burger is out of control!!

sOvyJPOZA2LQIu2aaxU2uw.text: I was surprised their food is really good and their bun the BUN will just melt in your mouth OMG

_fqb7dDAzot0pZdae2j-FQ.text: This is the best place in Vegas for a Dog, burger or sausage.  I always get the Kilbasa/Chicago style & the Hot link/Philly style. Both are outstanding. The Pastrami cheese/southwest style is awesome, the burgers are great, and the tater tots with Las Vegas chili rocks.

QtCxLs10hXALz4gW8qu4hg.text: As we were watching a movie my partner and I watched someone eat a hot dog so next thing you know we're yelping to find a good hot dog place. Since I don't eat beef I called around to a couple places to see if they served turkey dogs (yes I know I'm going to get stuff for eating a turkey dog but whateves). Great links had turkey options AND vegetarian options which is awesome! As soon as we got here we were greeted(can't remember his name :() but he was really nice and even made suggestions since we've never been here. I ordered a Chicago dog and a root beer float(delish, have one). My partner ordered a mob boss with a order of chili cheese fries. Everything was on point!!! A must have!!!

Wr9lilIvjLGYI0BadMOJmw.text: My friend took me here to great links. I ordered the old west burger and sweet potato French fries. Both were excellent and delicious. My friend ordered the Italian beef sandwich and a New York hot dog. He said they were awesome. The Owner is very friendly and greets many of his customers including us.(like the Mayor)

photos.caption: Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_QmV-8ybo-NCAhPzJ-jw7A.text: Once again in Vegas hunting down great gluten and dairy free food with good taste.  We came to Great Links looking for their organic salad, but they were out.  It turned out awesome though.  Most of their sausages and hot dogs are gf!  And they were happy to make a grilled chicken sandwich protein-style for my friend.  My polish sausage was beautifully presented.  The French fries were yummy and the homemade fry sauce was plentiful and quite excellent!  Really loved the root beer on draft.  (It took me back to my Midwest days.) Michelle was super cool and took wonderful care of us.  Everyone there was really friendly.  We'll definitely come back.  Later note... Something had gluten unfortunately.  I think it was either the butter alternate used to grill the onions or the special fry sauce (malt vinegar?).  Ask if you are super sensitive.  They are really nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Polish sausage made custom to what I wanted... Relish, kraut, grilled onions and mushrooms with mustard and ketchup.  No gluten!

29gQReMUfQq8mq27GX7iGA.text: Ooohh I love their burgers here--Specifically I've tried the Ortega Bacon Pepper jack Burger and Jalapeno Guacamole Burger. They have never disappointed me.   Try them all. Actually really anything here is good.--next time I'll go for the hot dogs

rscy0OL6JQZ-qWOX16_3vQ.text: I've been several times, and recommend to everyone... however, I brought an out of towner this past weekend, and was pretty disappointed. I got the wrong drink, my burger was wrong, and we only got one of our fry orders. Hopefully the next trip way over there will be worth it...

photos.caption: Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small, friendly, perfection.

MSiyikvXLBEwdlYAAkq-SQ.text: Came here based on the reviews. Really good service, the Italian fries are bomb. The breaded mushrooms had a doughy taste perhaps taken out of the fryer al little too soon. The chili cheese dog was ok, I assumed the cheese would have been melted but it wasn't. This place is ok I guess

2Q512U36KH8jch27e8pxPA.text: I have to agree, Ashley is an amazing server. My mom and I had stopped in earlier in the week and it was my first visit. I had a Bratwurst and my mom had the Italian beef. I was very impressed, thought it was a cute small spot with good food.  Tonight my daughter and I came back for a fun dinner on a girls night... They were very busy and only a few tables inside empty (they also have outdoor seating and a nice diner style bar)  Ashley was our server and their were two cooks, I thought when we walked in we may be waiting a while. Boy was I wrong. We had our drinks in no time, placed our order and enjoyed the Razorback game on one TV and The Cubbies on the other.  Our food was hot and fresh. As soon as our food came out of the fryer it was at our table and oh it was Wonderful!! Fried mushrooms in their beer batter was just the way to start. You must try the cottage fries which are really homemade chips!!  Being from the Chicago land area, I know a good Chicago dog and this was over the top. My daughter had the fish and chips and absolutely loved it!  Ashley had her hands full with all her tables, but you would have never known. She made it look like a breeze and we never felt neglected! She has a great personality and seems like she really enjoys her job! Both the cooks were nice and doing an amazing job getting food out dast, fresh and yummy!! One of the cooks even brought my daughter over a cookie when we were getting ready to leave, which really made her night. On our way out ashley told her to have a good week at school!  On the way home she kept telling me how many of their other treats she was going to try next time.  Can't wait to bring the hubby and kids in next weekend!!

2_ddOkxDnfJgWxraMlJkVw.text: I can't even begin to explain how awesome this place is, a colleague recommended it and it's amazing, I definitely don't go often enough, their food is awesome and all the employees are really cool!

4RvebQYPtcBTDzTCIhveQg.text: This is my first time eating here and just looking at the menu makes me wanna eat here all year! The environment in there is relaxing but it is a little too small to hang out in there for a long time.   They have hot dogs, various sausages, HUGE burgers, various types of fries including sweet potato fries. I'm sure there's more on the menu.  I Ordered the Smoked Sausage Deluxe Chili Cheese Dog and the Buffalo Style Fries. The Buffalo Fries was great!! The Chili Cheese Dog was good, but a little too salty for me.  Overall it's a good place to eat.

hQT_JDM8yDD_ggOfQTYw6Q.text: I found this place on Yelp when I was looking for a good place for our group of 7 to eat lunch. Our group order the Ruben which was very good and I had the jalapeno burger and it was one of the best burgers. The chili cheese fries and fried pickles were outstanding. The place was packed and I can see why, the food is delicious and the whole group was very happy.

R9FS9xbBpzk1D028NOWQZQ.text: We just left there.  The staff was soso. The kid who waited on us was very friendly. But the guy with the ponytail... Well lets just say he ruined our experience.  We all ordered shakes (which were made fresh but too milky, not sure if there was ice cream in there at all) but I never got mine. When we asked for it he said i didnt order one. I was the one that ordered all of them.  We ordered cheese fries with shoestring potatoes and got soggy crinkle cut ones.   But on a good note the dogs are really tasty and so was the chicken sandwich.

-7z4BOJFCf-UF67F18IK0Q.text: I know, I know...5 stars for hot dogs? But I love this place. It's easy, it's clean, the people that work there are happy and have a good time. AND there is nothing healthier than leaving the gym to have a hot dog and fries...so try their hot dogs!

vOWc4azK2pC1KrkMNpAs2g.text: Well first off, I have been excited to try this place for awhile, and unfortunately was let down.  When I walked in I was planning on ordering take out, and stepped straight to the counter where the menu was.  There were two guys (cooks) there in the open kitchen behind the bar, and there was zero greeting, so I decided whatever and seated myself as the sign says.  A young lady comes out and greets me and takes my drink order.  I order a root beer (which I was not aware that it was the non-refill type), the root beer was quite good and the highlight of the meal, so I will give it that.  I look over the menu a little more and decide on the chili dog and chili cheese fries, which I figured I couldn't go wrong with.  This is where my disappointment began, now I was pretty hungry not having eaten for several hours because of traveling so again I was looking forward to this...the fries were over cooked, and the chili had little to no taste, even after adding salt and pepper.  I ate most of them because I was hungry and they cost me good money.  Next was the chili dog which I was already worried about because of the fries, the dog comes out and it is pretty plain, just chili on top and nothing too large for $4+ and so I take a bit and yep I was right nothing special, same no taste chili and the hotdog is just average (Costco has better hotdogs), the cheap bun falls apart half way through for no reason (it wasn't the chili) and so that make it even worse.  Truthfully I wanted to just get up and leave as my server (who was a nice girl) had disappeared, and the two cooks wouldn't have even noticed or cared.  But I finished most of my meal and paid and left.  I wont be going back as there is nothing to go back for, tasteless food, average service, below average atmosphere.  And inflated pricing for what you get.  This is sad for me when I had great expectations for a locally owned place.

3P4hWrd1LGXJAJey9H0rnA.text: Once a summer, I allow myself the childhood pleasure I rarely indulge in HOT DOGS!  Ohmygosh, a girlfriend and I walked into this place after repeating the name several times and giggling. Let's do it, I ordered the "New Jersey" in honor of my roommate Steve who is from Jersey. It included delic green peppers, onions, mustard and ketchup with a perfectly crispy bun. I was in hot dog heaven, it seriously hit the spot. The spiciness with those onions. Score!  What a great hangover cure, HOT DOGS.  Who would think it? :)

mK-i2pSrxGMqS3TFEhb5Ig.text: I just got back from Vegas and my good friend had taken me and my wife there on the way to our hotel. I had no clue what this place was but it was really cool. They have a lot more than hot dogs. The beer was cheap, the dogs were good and the desserts were not bad either. I had a Boston Dog and it was better than I thought it would be. Its a small place so good luck finding a place to sit on the weekend. This place was good enough for us to go back before we had to go to the airport to come home.  Peace Out  MZ

X3lMc01sOPO3bwQ8dMqMow.text: Every time my boyfriend and I eat here they remember us! It feels like home and always has delicious food! Can't ask for more:)

7TO1mrMgVlB7GTPd7afIiw.text: My new home away from home!  Hot Dogs - one of my favorite foods, and Great Links hasn't let me down once!  What a menu!  So hard to decide what to order, but one thing I know for sure, their Cottage Fries (potato chips) ROCK!  Give them a try, you won't be disappointed!

pntluT8xO7wWO7c9SpUTDw.text: My husband and I went here today, on a Saturday. We've passed this place several times and always said we'd eat here. If it wasn't for the need to go to Lowes, we would have missed out on how great this place is!   It was around 2:30ish so we must have just missed the lunch crowd. As we were looking over the menu, I know I was constantly changing my mind of what I wanted. Then I saw the bratwurst and my mind was made up. Same for my husband. In fact, we decided to order two of the #3 (brat, drink, and fries). I ordered my brat with K-up, mustard, cheese, and onions (Yum!); the fries the crinklely ones and my husband ordered his with the spicy mustard only; the fries traditional.  We were not disappointed with our food at all. In fact, we both wanted another despite already been stuffed. A couple for the road maybe? As others have mentioned in their reviews, these dogs do have a "snap" to them when you take that first bite. It's the way a dog or a brat should be. All dogs and fries are made fresh when ordered, which you can tell. The refills on your drinks are free and automatically served in those take-out cups so you can fill up before heading out the door.   Even though we both got the brats, we will definitely go back (Lowes stop or not) and try their other dogs. The space is kind of small but I think it addes to the atmosphere and there's counter sitting as well. This restaurant also had a warm, friendly feeling to it. I also get the feeling it's family run which is great to see. We highly recommend Uncle Al's!

ILwPq8pJx1qLCVga9Le2Fw.text: Amazing $5 lunch. This is an little place tucked into a strip mall. The staff is very nice and the menu is big. I recommend the $5 Special, you get a hot dog, corn dog, fries, soda and either chicken nuggets or grilled cheese. What a deal and everything was really good. If this was closer to my house I would eat here all the time!

PqvaebFCNt80UhR2n_HWYQ.text: Great place to eat. Spinach and asiago dog is sooo good! Reuben was great too!! I will come here again.

_7TVSHf4WDKt3bhfw5cpBA.text: I've been here a few times and have not been disappointed.  A great dog with a great selection of toppings.  The place is clean and tidy, something I always look for before I eat a thing. The staff is friendly and helpful, I enjoy it here.

UAUZFBEq2eNuzlj6YIFfSw.text: "Super yummy sausages and nice, fresh tomatoes and excellent dill relish! Great variety between dogs, sausage and burgers. Fun sides and really nice people! Go check them out so they stay open!"

Im_xvD1C56ypfR2GXyfWsA.text: will wait to go a few times before bumping to 5 stars....but first time was awesome!  had to get the LV chili dog...delicious. that sage chili rocks. and the dill relish compliments it ridiculously well. dog itself was good, too. paired it w/ some cottage fries w/ cayenne sour cream to dip in and a big cold sprecher root beer, on tap no less.  place has a great looking menu (good selection of creative dogs, sausages, burgers and sammiches), nice selection of sides (fried pickles and green beans!) and a surprisingly decent beer selection (for a hot dog and burger grill). plus malts, shakes, etc.  and....they have vegetarian options. my girl is vegetarian....want to take her here so she can try a beer brat! (kinda curious about how a veggie brat tastes myself....)

photos.caption: Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. LV chili dog...

9BfNeeKeN0YiZdtV35NZiQ.text: I've never lived in Chicago, but sometimes I sure miss Chicago Dogs. And though there are some places to get a reasonable interpretation of a Chicago Dog, none of them really hit it right in every single way...until now!  Uncle Al's uses their very own dogs and that's part of what makes this place so special. Their dogs "snap" when you bite in, just like a good Chicago dog should. (They have skinless for you wusses that don't understand the True nature of a good dog.)  Aside from Chicago, they have about another dozen styles of hot dogs -- all of them wrong except the Chicago. (Ketchup?? On a hot dog? Ew!) They also have a variety of other sandwiches and burgers, but if you have any sense in your head, you come here for the dogs.  Aside from the dogs, they have real french fries. They're kind of limp but for some reason, I still really like them. I've tried the coleslaw twice and regretted it twice. Stick to the dogs...and the limp fries.

Q4yFtqt69eSojeoEVIyj1g.text: Found this place on yelp after craving a good hot dog. Good food, Nice atmosphere, and great staff. I tried the Atlanta Slaw Dog. I loved the homemade slaw. Definitely going back to get another and try the other hot dogs

xijiw4p74wVh0zYz3LqKZQ.text: Great place to eat good portions big menu its always a struggle to decide everything I've had here has been excellent from cheese frys to the links amazing. Only thing its a small space and I have a big fam and it gets pretty crowded sometimes but over all the food and service trumps all. They also serve one of my fav beers on tap amber bock plus a good bottled selection highly recommend.

JlTvALn5ddn4WoRxN11Vqw.text: Went to this place after reading some reviews on yelp and I definitely wasn't disappointed! I got onion rings and the las vegas chili dog..soo amazing! I would go to this place again :)

Opokt-3blZyji6xZVFyPOg.text: Alright, I went to this place after reading the great reviews. So maybe my experience was based off good expectations. However, I ordered the southern hot dog and my wife got the Chicago dog. I also got home-style fries and she got the mozzarella sticks.   The hot dogs were alright and tasted pretty good, nothing amazing and I found them comparable to Sonic's hot dogs.  The mozzarella sticks probably came straight from the freezer from Costco or the like and were nothing original.  The home-style french fries were disgusting. I think they let the potatoes set out too-long, because the fries tasted bad, were very soggy, and lacked any taste other than oil. I do not know how it is possible to have a burned soggy fry.  The service was horrible. The owner was there when we went and it was not busy at all, but we had to wait 15 minutes to order even though our waitress was sitting directly in-front of us watching Sponge-bob Square-pants. We were clearly ready to order for at least five minutes before because we decided to fold our menus up to make it even more obvious that we were ready to go. When we left, we went through a similar situation, not sure if we should just walk up to the cash register at the front or wait for somebody to come to our table. We finally decided to ask somebody to ring us up and we were off.  This was a really lame experience, especially after the great reviews.

mySv4jbFjqnWrtaShOUFIQ.text: Love this place!! Since I lived the first 24 years of my life in the Mid-West (Detroit area)  I really miss this type of food/restaurants.  This place is great.  Thankfully its across town from me so I don't get there often or I'd have to buy a Radio Flyer wagon to carry my fat a$$ around!

7hMO1nqWWQUhpPYT8pJKCQ.text: I ate at Great Links towards the end of a long trip in Las Vegas.  The only regret I have is that I didn't go sooner so that I could have gone there more then once.  The hot dogs were excellent and the fries and tater tots were as well.   I went to Pinks at Planet Hollywood earlier in the trip and it was average at best - not to mention way overpriced.   I don't know if I would prefer this place to Carney's in LA if they were side by side but in Vegas this is the place to get a very good hot dog!

4FFnWTH9YioDLI0ojryx7Q.text: Hot Dog Heaven. First, I love hot dogs so when I found this place shortly after moving here I was so excited. The dogs themselves are perfect, with a nice snap at each bite. They offered a huge variety...I had the cheese dog with cold cheddar (rather than cheese sauce or melted cheddar) and my husband had a chili cheese dog. Both were delicious. We we're impressed with the variety of sides (fried pickles, zucchini, tots, fries, etc) and the draft root beer was awesome.

gM9ECPiCIikdfXXFeQkaZg.text: Decided while I was on that side of town to try this place, since I noticed they had won on Burger Wars on FOX NEWS. I am sure glad I did! The food was AMAZING! Service was Great! It was worth the trip out there (even though I was all ready on this side) My Burger was the best! I'll be back! Thank You for such a great Experience and I can see why you have won three years running!

MiBLTZn4rnqWgya7Ai_C3A.text: Not to often I want a hot dog for dinner, so when the craving hit , we headed to great links because of the great reviews. I had the New York style( onion sauce saurkraut)  the weiner it self had a nice snap when u bit into it , the onion sauce was like a watered down ketchup with onion pieces in it. The bun was kinda soggy at bottom , maybe supposed to b that way ? Never been to New York,  so I don't know, but  I find it hard  to believe a new yorker or anyone for that matter would buy this hot dog at a cart only to have it drip all over them.            We also ordered the pastrami on rye , the meat was plentiful,  but a little salty for me , wife said  not salty , may be me.                                   We also got fried zucchini and chili cheese fries . The zucchini was awsome nice batter and crispy. The chili cheese fries were good , chili tasted like canned stuff to me . The sides zucchini & fries came out first , we were almost done with the sides then came the hot dogs. It was not busy, so the wait confused me. I don't think hot dog should take so long .  The menu is huge and looks intresting , so I will b back to give it another shot.       Service was friendly, but a little slow.

2WJ_hzbL6gWTXHpaKy25Rw.text: I just had the most amazing grilled cheese sandwhich here! I was craving an egg sandwhich so the staff were very kind to let me add a fried egg to my grilled cheese with tomato on Rye. They don't usually serve breakfast on weekdays, but they let me special order since they were not busy. It is not everyday that you find a place that is a hole in the wall greasy spoon with good home cooked food!! Seriously, best grilled cheese/egg sandwhich I have ever had. They also have amazing fries and rootbeer floats!!

1c59_lNm_23HqndMTmL57A.text: First time here, and I love it! The service is friendly, the atmosphere is fun, and the food is phenomenal! Had the Chicago dog and loved it! The menu is very varied, so I'll definitely be back to try more!

aH3jtG02Xk5l1u9xO-NkVQ.text: Great Links is a haven for vegetarian junk food lovers in the Northwest side of town.  Let me tell you what they offer for vegetarians:  vegetarian hot dogs, vegetarian chicken,  vegetarian Italian sausage,  vegetarian kielbasa,  vegetarian beer brats,  vegetarian bacon,  & vegetarian chili!!!   This means that, as a vegetarian, you can order a hot dog topped with strips of bacon and a pile of chili. Yes, it's possible. I did it. And I think it was only $4.   I love this place. It can get really busy, but it's affordable and the servers are always nice.

IcuuCd8UgGU2huyhbCCBLg.text: I came here with my boyfriend and my 2 daughters. My boyfriend had heard great things about this place so we had been wanting to test it out. The service was awesome. As soon as we walked in we were able to find a table that sat 4 people. The waiter greeted us right away and also brought a crayon box and a stack of blank paper for my daughters to draw on. He went over the menu with us and gave us recommendations on what he liked. Also let us know how the menu worked and that we could put any toppings on anything. Very nice guy, I even had a headache and he was able to give me some Advil. What waiter helps you out with that. Awesome! Our food came out in a timely manner and it was fresh and hot. Everything was great! It's hard to find good Chicago food along with good friendly people and this place has both. We will def be coming back.

EGFmDEN3ItHTH2ws35P9lA.text: I used to bring my family here as a treat. The burgers were to.die.for! Big fat yummy, tender, juicy, seasoned ground beef, just like dad used to bbq. Today, I got a tough, tasteless, cardboard replica of a Sams club or Costco bulk frozen patty. Since when does 100% ground beef have 90 degree hard edges? The bun was soaked in grease, and it was essentially a crunchy chewy greasy blob of gunk. The saving grace were the fries and beautifully blended Coke. (Note: your $7.99 burger only comes as a burger - no fries, salad or even a pickle. Your fries are gonna set you back another three bucks on any dog, sandwich or entree.) I'm so sad. When I was craving an old fashioned thick, juicy, tasty burger on a toasted warm bun, I'd run to Great Links. Now, I'm off south bound to SkinnyFats.

VhkKS7Lad__Pq6VlKG5raA.text: If you're looking for an exceptional burger or dog this is the place!! Awesome staff, great service and beer! We got the the fried mushrooms to start then had to get an order of Itialian fries. I had the jalapeno guacamole cheese burger which was evertything i wanted in a burger. I highly recommend this place, they were awesome to bs with too!

c5Ohk7zy76XX8z06--himg.text: Since discovering Great Links about a year ago my husband, son and I eat here at least 2-3 times a month (it's our go-to place on a Saturday/Sunday afternoon). After all the times we have eaten here, we still haven't even scratched the surface of their menu! Everything I have tried has been absolutely amazing! So far my favorites are the NASCAR specials (I really wish they would still serve last year's special though) and their Italian fries. The prices are extremely resonable, we usually order 2 dogs (or burgers/sandwiches), 2 orders of fries, 2 soft drinks and a kids meal (includes drink and cookies for dessert) and I don't think we have ever paid more than $25.   The quality of their food is top-notch and the food is always served piping hot and fast. The thing that really makes this place worth visiting is the service. I always see the owner there which is a True sign of pride in ownership and Michelle is one of the hardest working people I have ever met. The place is always packed with people and yet the staff manages to keep everyone happy and they do it with a smile on their face even though you know thay have got to be exhausted!   They also keep the place very clean both in the dinning area, grill area and the restrooms. One of my biggest pet peeves is a dirty bathroom... I have been know to actually walk out of a place because of the condition of the bathroom (I'm kind of a germ-a-phobe when it comes to public toilets), I can honestly say that Great Links has one of the cleanest bathrooms I have ever seen in a restaurant.  I've heard through the grape vine that the owners are having some financial trouble recently and despite the success of Great Links may be forced to close their doors. I truley hope this does not happen. I tell everyone I know about this place in hopes that the increase in business will help keep this place going even though it means they will be even busier and I will probably have to wait more, it is definitely worth the wait!

q5409kiAxWBByp1Q9BThzQ.text: Great food and friendly staff.  I have never had a bad experience yet in 6 visits.  Highly recommend brats and Philly cheesesteaks but everything is good.

FBG9ZjkGU_wEo6j3HRiXWA.text: I would l like to say I have a good review, but unfortunately not. I really think that service is the key to great reviews and even if the food or product isn't good most would at least consider a second chance in order for one's to redeem themselves just because of great service. But in my case that service never really came. I went to the place after work one night. After seeing it the day prior while on that side of town, I was excited to see something outside the typical here and there fast food. Plus it never hurts to see so many good reviews on yelp.  I drove out of my way that night and made it to the restaurant about 8:15. I admit I was apprehensive being out late and not familiar with the place and its operating hrs but after seeing a small group of what appeared to be customers because the waitress was serving them drinks and clearly reading the sign outside for a minute or so I proceeded in. I was happy to see a employee come hastily over to what I thought was  greet me but instead of that he rudely said that they closed at 8 and that I needed to go. I was shocked and embarrassed. He walked away never said sorry or please come again just walked away. I then left but not after reading the sign again which clearly stated 9 p.m. I also considered that the doors were still open. I sat in the parking lot and watched for a few minutes and also noted that no-one came to lock the doors which is standard procedure for most places when closing and not wanting any other patrons to make same mistakes but nothing happened.  I watched as the waitress continued to serve the group inside. 5 minutes passed and another tray of food came out to the group. I drove away quite upset vowing never to even attempt to come again. I suggest to anyone interested not to come after 8 or you just might be wasting your time because they clearly don't want to serve anyone according to the sign in the window. And maybe if the owners read this you will change the sign so no-one else does the same thing and you don't lose more of what could be potential customers.

FC1FblBbegE5UYfnYu59vg.text: Very good hot dogs. Loved the natural casing. It almost reminded me of the hot dogs I use to it back home.

8lr05CMHQCLZTLDh_cYgGQ.text: I had heard of this place a long time ago and forgot about it by the time I moved to the area.  I saw it recently while driving around and thought "gee, I gotta get me some of that."  So come Saturday I was really craving a hot dog and off I went to be wrapped up in the menu like a hot dog in a bun.  It is a big menu for such a small place.  There are many different varieties of hot dogs as one might expect from a place called Great Links Hot Dogs.  But there is so much more.  There are also many types of sausage sandwiches to choose from as well.  Did I forget to mention they are famous for their burgers.  Yeah, they have won the Burger Wars burger competition two years running.  Then there are the many diffferent fried potato variations and combinations too.  Onion rings, jalapeno poppers, fried mushrooms.  The menu goes on and on.  I was so fascinated in all the offerings they have that I forgot all about my hot dog craving and went with a sausage sandwich instead.  It was a toss up between the Roasted Garlic and Mozzarela or the Spinach and Asiago Cheese.  The Spinach and Asiago is topped with mustard, mayo, tomato, pickles, relish and sport peppers not unlike a Chicago style hot dog.  It sounded damn good as a Chicago style dog is my favorite.  In the end it was the Roasted Garlic and Mushroom sausage that won my stomach and my heart.  A perfectly grilled chicken sausage stuffed with cheese and mushrooms then topped with grilled onion, bell peppers and mushrooms with the addition on marinara on top of that.  I also got an order of the stuffed jalapenos.  There were six in a basket and were served piping hot fresh out of the fryer.  The crisp coating was not oily despite being fried for about 4 minutes.  The molten cream cheese inside was nearly too much for my mouth to handle but the cooling richness of the ranch dip helped everything slide down.  Add a 22 ounce Amber Bock beer and Saturday is now the happiest day of the week.

fqEidPjUarV52QxVwrr8fg.text: Moved from NJ and missed our hot dog joint.  Someone recommended Great Links and it's awesome.  Walk in and sit where ever you like.  No fuss, no muss.  Super casual, laid back atmosphere.  It's a hot dog joint!  Big menu, great chili hot dogs, root beer on tap, beer on tap, SUPER friendly staff.  To go food too.  Like the counter seats - you can watch the cooks :)   Non smoking - no gambling - thankful for that, (no tourists) lots of parking.  Look forward to trying the sausage next time.  We will be back!  UPDATE:  was there tonight 1/1/15 and had the sausage,peppers,onions. Hot sausage! It was awesome. Only bummer, serving size is super small. One link on a hotdog size bun. Back in NJ this would be on a big roll with about 3 links and tons of peppers and onions. True hoagie style. So order two or three if you're hungry!  But def try it. It's delish.

l728c0J9dDYPYk7XLIk08A.text: This is just for the hamburger.. See my reviews for the other stuff.. I don't see how they won the burger wars.. It's a frozen patty and taste like it too! The lettuce became so soggy so fast it stopped my bite, it wouldn't tear at all, when I tried to bite into the burger the whole slice of lettuce came out without breaking off.. I tried to pull it apart with my hands and couldn't!! I'm not weak either.. I think I found something stronger than 550 cord. I was disappointed as everything else here is so awesome!

kRADP7lPHvK65Q66Q34U7g.text: Stellar burgers, pastrami, chili cheese fries, hot dogs, shakes. Staff was Nice. Clean!   I love open plan kitchens where u can talk to your chef. Totally unpretentious. If ur a "junk foodie" you'll love this place.  One of only a few mom and pop burger joints in LV with a lot of care put into their "fast food" I would eat here three times a week if it was closer to me.

i2GDzGXbu28BEkhB0TIsJg.text: This place was amazing! Service was great and the food even better !! It was our first time but it is our new favorite. It has the small intimate family owned feel and the meat is top quality. The food combined with the great service left us very impressed

16qE1IeUzixoCvwF_Ullkw.text: Every time we go it's great. If i have one complaint it's probably the lack of seating because it's just a small location. But otherwise, the staff are friendly and the food is good and fairly priced.

sZhbjzV79WYTqUdaQ5r3Ag.text: Quite possibly the best Hot Dog I've ever eaten!  This place warrants 5 stars not only because the food was great, the service was excellent and our party even received a free hot dog because the waitress mistakenly thought we ordered an additional hot dog and ended up just giving it to us anyways.   I'd highly recommend the Chicago Dog.  It had the right amout of crispness and bite.  The onions were savory and the dog itself was pretty spicy.  This place is also very reasonably priced.

Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Chicago Dog....spicy!

qm53aSCMukVuh16agd8PRQ.text: First, if you're staying in a strip hotel, Great Links is a pretty good ride depending on traffic (which was deadly today!)...But, worth it.   I visited Great Links this afternoon.  Excellent.  Great diner atmosphere, exceptionally friendly and quick service along with tasty food.    I sampled the Mob Boss dog and the Original hot dog.  WOW!    First I tried the original hot dog.  It was a traditional natural casing dog with onions, relish, mustard and catsup.  Great taste, good snap to the dog and nice flavor.  Then, I manned up and tried the Mob Boss which  has grilled onions, peppers, mushrooms, cheese sticks, and marina sauce.  Great flavor, good snap to the dog and enormous.  Truly, a meal on a bun.  Stop in here while you're visiting Vegas.  It is worth the trip off the strip.

xgSvyjYxrgfByeA7JS5_RA.text: In fairness, we have never done take out from Great Links,  and after last night, we won't do take out again.  The brand new employee, thrown on the phone orders at dinner time, had the worst phone skills of any adult I'd ever met. It took him 10 mins to write out the following order: 1 onion ring 1 crinkle fry 1 veg ck patty with buffalo sauce, minus dairy. 1 veg patty with mushrooms, no dairy. I requested extra raw onions. 10 minutes of telling me uh hold on, while he wrote.  P/u time 20 to 25 mins. We arrived in 15. Our food was already bagged and waiting. We took it home, the 10 mins it took to get inside and put our food on plates, the fried food had saturated the paper bags and the bottoms fell out. The burgers sucked.  I never take pics of food for reviews, but was so pissed off to have spent 24$ on this quality of food, with 2$  as a tip. No onions at all on my burger, and at best 5 slices of mushrooms.  The previous time we ate in, roughly a month ago, they were extremely short handed and the cooks were made to serve tables. The same order above did take them 25 minutes, which is crazy long. As chefs by trade we know about being short handed in the kitchen.  This happens, but it seems like Great Links is trying to cut cost, and in turn they're going to lose business.  We love going here as a go to near our house, so I hope Great Links gets their stuff together.

photos.caption: Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No onions, requested extra. Mushroom burger. Where are the mushrooms? The mayo was added by me at home.

01-XJeD3DFckHnV1d7bifg.text: best food by far in vegas! the staff is friendly and never disappoints. the burgers are the best in town, with the most flavor. the chicken bacon ranch is my go to sandwich. i highly recommend this spot to any one that comes to vegas!

-Y8KV3RcgdKQBgplVeU1sA.text: I love this place, don't eat here very often any more (since adjusting my diet) but every time we do it is awesome. I would never imagine eating or buying custom hot dogs but this place kills it, hot dogs, burgers, sandwiches n don't forget the Buffalo Cheesy Tots.  The staff is always down to earth n nice

VWDK5Zj13dy_XsQE69zcug.text: Seventy Nine reviews to date and a solid four and a half star rating for the best hot dog & hamburger joint in the United States, yep, I said it, the BEST hot dog & hamburger joint in the United States!!!!!!!  I can't remember the name of this place when it first opened but I do remember falling in love the first time I walked through the door, every city in the United States should have a great hot dog & hamburger joint but alas, it is not to be.  If you go here expect a line because great food joints have lines and Great Links usually has a line, if there is a line just wait till a seat opens up, it is worth the wait.  First the staff, these guys and gals are AWESOME .............. this place is like Cheers and even if they don't know your name they will make you feel at home.  Now the food, where to start ................. EVERYTHING IS AWESOME!!!!!!!  They offer two styles of hot dogs, the natural casing or as they would tell you, the casing that "snaps", and the skinless casing. Both are 100% beef, I am a skinless guy myself but I have had both and I would not turn down either.   There are twenty nine, yep, 29 different hot dogs & sausage items on the menu and they are all mouth watering, remember when you were a boy, how freaking awesome is summertime delicious!!!!!  the Las Vegas Chili Dog is the bomb, the Philly Griller Dog is delectable, the Mob Boss Dog is exquisite, and the Louisiana Hot Link is Extraordinary.  I love their old school crinkle cut fries, the burgers are tasty, juicy goodness and don't even get me going about the atmosphere of the place .................. it is one of those places where you feel at home the first time you walk in the door.   OK, I just gave a hot dog & hamburger joint a five star review after promising my fellow Yelpers that I would reserve my five star reviews for the best of the best, so in other words ...................... NAILED IT!!!!!!!  Until next time fellow Yelpers ................. Be Local, Live Local, Buy Local!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great Links in Veags, the writing on the wall says it all!!!

3LUcQBPvC31lfWDv6FVkoA.text: Decided to try this place because of the great reviews, but I really did not enjoy it.  - The waitress didn't know the menu, told us the Italian beef had cheese and It did not.  - All the tables had empty ketchup bottles that was annoying - it took almost 40 minutes to get our food, it was 4 sandwiches and fries.  - The Italian beefs sandwiches were bland as hell, from reading the past reviews it seems this place is falling behind.   Would not come back  Side note - group of 4 came in @ 6pm

C_zj19GgRqvPvcJl8ZBSoQ.text: No bueno... The food here was very bland to me. When i think of great links I think spicy savory tasty and i didn't get any of that from this experience. This is not a place i will be back to since the food just didn't do it for me.   The staff was nice but not enough to get them a higher rating since the food was so blah to me. Oh well

tJfLw6zSul_Y8IW-6-SgXA.text: PW wanted wieners and when he's hungry, you're better off just going with the flow. Besides we had to give him an opportunity to make up for his food court fiasco the other day. Good call! I too am now a fan of the wiener.  Our waitress, Michelle, greeted us promptly, took our drink orders, and made a few suggestions for the midday meal. We went with three different kinds of french fries as appetizers and all were outstanding. Cheesy buffalo, buttery garlic, and grilled onions had us all drooling when they were brought to the table.   I opted for the Philly Griller. Covered with grilled peppers and onions, it was quite possibly the best tube steak I've ever consumed. PW got some sort of chili dog, as did IW (no relation).   They have root beer on tap as well as draft beers. Definitely coming back for a bite and a brew. Lunch for three was just north of thirty bucks and worth much more. This place gets pumping at lunch time but is definitely worth a short wait. Their menu is pretty extensive including burgers, fish and a variety of sausages.  A five-star experience all around. Even if you're not a fan of the wiener you'll be sure to find something to please your palate.

OftZk8cHrQyKoGgM49HBFg.text: Amazing! Everytime we come here to eat it's always delicious!!! Thanks Jeff for making yummy dogs! Great service from Julian!

photos.caption: Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicago dogs .. one with added peppers

En5ZOeaK86aChOCysMG_LA.text: I was disappointed in the service within moments of walking in the door. However, I was still excited to try the food.   There were three guys preparing the food, and one woman who ran the register as well as the entire floor. She greeted us by asking if our order was for there or to go. Since we said 'to go', she said that she would help us in a moment. She then proceeded to take an order at one table, ring up another table, and check on one more table before returning to take our order.  Okay, this was fine. Sort of. What ruined the visit for me was how she chewed her gum, open-mouth and all, while took our order. She didn't look at us, and didn't say anything when she presented us with our receipt to sign. No enthusiasm or care for anything, especially our business. That makes me angry.   We both got the 'Chicago Dog'. Since the dogs are made with Boar's Head meat, they did have pretty good flavor. However, maybe we should have chosen something other than a Chicago dog, as nothing compares to the real thing.   Would I go back again?...possibly. Chicago Dog?...nope. To-go?...yes, if I called my order in ahead of time.

L-nBMf9wbB2wMypqbqA0SQ.text: My hubby had a craving to come here. He'd eaten there but I'd never been before so I decided to give it a try. We had to wait a while for our food because the place was so busy. I ordered a pastrami sandwich, garlic parm fries AND a chili dog (for later). We placed our order to go.  Upon getting home and opening the bag, everything looked really appetizing. I planned to eat the chili dog and fries for lunch and save the pastrami sandwich for dinner.  after two bites of the chili dog.....I was like no. Its hard for me to put into words how it tasted to me. Almost chemical like someone dipped it into a cleaning solution.  I tried another bite when common sense set in and my only thought was, "your body is trying to tell you something, don't eat it". I don't know if maybe I'm allergic to something in the meat but I had an aversion to it. The fries were very tasty but swimming in oil. That was the bulk of my meal for that sitting.  The pastrami sandwich was alright. I wouldn't go out of my way to go there for it. I did manage to finish it though.

hKZ--pQSaObXJ0aDdQ9wAw.text: I like their dogs,  best ones in town.   Customer service usually sucks though because the staff gets so bitchy.    Today my experience here was worse than in the past.   They had the basketball game so loud that it was hard to be heard by the cashier when ordering (TV is right above the ordering station for to go orders).   After waiting for several minutes to be acknowledged by the staff someone came to the register.   The order taking guy didn't look at me once during the order and I had the distinct feeling I was keeping him from his tables. I tried to order what I used to get (was called the Great Linkisi or some such) and instead of telling me "we don't make that anymore" the order taker simply denied all knowledge of the old flagship dog and didn't offer similar options even when asked.   He was not even willing to check with another staff member to see if they knew what it was (and a lot of these guys have worked here for a while).

vS2poWUFzl0LUpEyEn2tOw.text: Easily one of the best "hot dog/sausage" centric diners I have visited.  But, don't just focus on the tube meats. The sandwiches (pastrami, cheese steak, Chicago beef) and burgers are amazing too. The quality of the meats and large array of toppings are the difference makers; great recipes and service of hot and flavorful dishes are the best!!! Working our way thru the menu has been an adventure full of outstanding eats. Definitely try the white chili on dogs, sausages or burgers. Any of the fries are perfect - hot and super crisp. Can you tell I like this place???  LOL. Great service and a super talented chef along with willingness to make anything you can think of as toppings or prep make this an easy choice. Owned a small barbecue place myself, and these folks really hit every single mark.

KPRXztEq66l7-c8aGz9gxQ.text: I love this place ! Being vegetarian it's super difficult finding a place that my boyfriend and I can both enjoy. Especially when his favorite things to eat are hotdogs and hamburgers. The food was great, don't get me wrong it was greasy but just the way it should be! We can't wait to go back.

Bj4NCP8GpFrevZanyagHIA.text: Ohhh I wanted to like it! We live in Henderson, so it took a lot to convince my roommate to drive the 30 miles one way -- I had to offer to pay LOL so off we went. I ordered NY Street Dog, waffle fries & BBQ Western Burger w/bacon. I have to admit when the food got to the table, in the cute little bar style baskets -- I turned to my roommate and said "disgusting". It was so gross, to me (and I'm from the west coast) but it was all Chicago style -- like a mess. It wasn't the type of food you can just pick up and eat, the bun - from both the hot dog and the burger were just saturated, wet, soggy, mushy like dough like gross - which is where my "disgusting" game from. So the hotdog was some type of pressed meat type of hot-dog, like a cheap hot dog and it was not grilled. It was not a good, high quality hot dog at all. What I didn't like was it was all pink - inside and out I don't know I like my hotdogs grilled with like grill marks on the outside. This dog sat down in the soggy bun covered with sour croute and mustard. I bit off the one end and pushed the hotdog over to my roommate. He cut his burger in half and gave me half - same thing, and I wanted to take a picture but I felt silly - it was a big piece of mush. Seriously like 34 of it had been dipped in BBQ sauce........... It seems like the BBQ burger had some kind chili on it or something but it was all over saturated with BBQ/Chili sauce. I took a bite, the burger itself seemed like a good burger - and I did like the actual meat of the burger itself but as the BBQ sauce got all over my hands and fingers it was a mess, yucky - I set the rest of the burger in its basket and pushed it away. I went to the bathroom to wash my hands. Oh ya and they were out of waffle fries - so we opted for the "natural" fries, which ya, were very greasy. We ate all of the fries, because we were hungry and both of us not too happy with the meals - the little sauces that came with the fries was good  some kind of Cajun sauce and what seemed to be tarter.  Like I said I wanted to like this place, I like the decor and the waitress was very nice but this place is not my style. I'll continue on my personal search for a great Las Vegas burger.

And I just tried the jalapeno poppers...WOW. The cook by the bar was so nice too while my boyfriend and I were eating. They're all so kind. Love it and will always be back for more of course!

Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kielbasa sauerkraut Swiss and thousand island. Almost a Ruben

4w2E5qHzYD3VbkMVQv00gA.text: This is our second time eating at Great Links.  The first time was 6 months ago and not a good experience.  Tried it again today and worse, so here is our review.  We sat down and the waitress/cashier took our order.  5 minutes later we received our 2 orders of fries, which was ok, but the rest of our food didn't arrive for another 15 minutes.  So basically the fries were almost cold when our hotdogs arrived.  We then received the rest of our food but one order was completely wrong.  The waitress apologized and sent it back to the cook, but it was another 10-15 minute wait for them to make it again.  Fries are now ice cold at this point.  No offer to give us a discount, get us hot fries, nada.    Went to the counter to pay and now another person emerged from the back.  He printed our receipt, I handed him my debit card, he charged it and handed it back for me to sign.  All this without saying ONE WORD to us.  No hi, thank you, how was your meal, have a nice day......nothing.  I walked out thinking "what a jerk".    The waitress was very nice, but everything else was less than satisfactory.  I'll normally give a place two times before we zap them from our restaurant list.  They've been zapped......

qyBEymnwRESJ9ItmkuOWpg.text: Now Great Links is not a place I think most people should visit more than a few times a year. Yes, the menu items are very tempting and on days when you are craving calorie adding and artery clogging foods, this is the place to go.  I was excited to see they offer veggie options and that is what I ordered: vegetarian chili and vegetarian hot dog plus a side salad. Most other items are fried, covered in cheese and sauces. I see this place as somewhere to stop by to watch the game, have a beer and eat some fried foods.  The open kitchen with the bar next to it is very inviting to chat with the employees. There aren't very many seats other than that so maybe getting items to go is another option. The restaurant could use a deep cleaning on the floors and such- it felt a bit grimy to me.  Also, I saw an employee serve himself a fountain drink and drink it in the kitchen. Later the same employee scratched his head/neck while behind the counter next to the stove.  I don't know, the heavy greasy foods and the lack of cleanliness of the place are enough for me to pass on this as a choice next time I am in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian hot dog and vegetarian chili.

PsGZljkKpfMkOkF6dBWPXQ.text: Wow. Great menu, and everything we've tried has been delicious. Fair prices, good service, and a nice selection of beer. I definitely recommend you give this place a try.

Psl6GEei5VcAVqMk5IxDsQ.text: Fist time eating here. Very pleased with the customer service and great staff. I ordered a massive 1/2 lb kielbasa and I'm stuffed. Delicious and definitely will return.

R28IcKW9091LFC6PLmClWQ.text: What better way to kick off the New Year by reviewing another local business!? Also, since Yelp only allows you to rate 1-5stars and nothing in between, I've come up with a "Shaka-Meter" where it allows 0-10 Shakas ..\uuu/...and everything in between!  So we were in the area and have always passed Great Links, but this time, we stopped in for a bite. Locally owned and run, staff makes you feel at home. We split the Vegas Chili Dog and I got the Pastrami Cheeseburger. Wifey got a Bacon Cheeseburger and  we both got some delicious Death Valley Root Beer on tap! Woooohooo!!!  The burgers were okay, just too well done for my taste, but the star was the Vegas Chili Dog. I love the snap you get from each bite! We plan to return, but unless they cook burgers to a desired temperature, I'll just go down the hot dog side of the menu, or maybe even choose from the wide variety of menu items they have.   ALOHA!!!  Shaka-Meter: \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uu   3.5  YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(1/365) "Wassup Dog!?!?"

k44yaYmEBslZ0edF88dPog.text: Well I have had yelp for a while and have never written a review ... the food was amazing however the service was not . She acted like a child, literally threw my burger on the table without saying a word and walked away. We did nothing to deserve this animosity. The food was incredible and I would definitely come back..... just without a different server .

3OMfcYjGpnpX8cxsBVg04g.text: This is one of the best dog and burger places around. I had the jalapeno guacamole burger and my husband had the Chicago dog and we shared. TRm-SUGI69eNWH4KmN9cOg.text: If you are throwing your calorie counter out the window this is the place to do it. The food is very good and the prices are very competitive.  Our server was personable and made us feel very comfortable. We will be back.

kmTQ9IBUA6CHT5tPtEMnpg.text: In Vegas for work and wanted to find a place for a good burger. We yelped burgers & beer and this place popped up. Figured it was off the tourist path we will give it a try. Holy Cow! So happy we did!!!  We had the sweetest waitress, Journey, she was so helpful with suggestions of customer favorites. We ordered a chili burger, the sage chili is amazing, chicken tenders, perfectly breaded & cooked & not over greasy, fried zucchini & onion rings. Let me tell you we left stuffed and happy. I will definitely make my way back in next time we are in town.

T-V2O2bE0fudZ2DXkIkKvg.text: Best Vegetarian/Vegan Food in Vegas !!! Vegetarian Cheese Steak , Chicken Nuggets , Bacon , Hot Dogs , Bratwurst , Chili , Burgers , Italian Sausage and more !!!! Bomb.com

roIxJP_iUAh0qIKlhJx25A.text: Most places with veg options = side salad, fries, &/or veggie burger....but not this place!  You have the options of 4 diff veggie hot dogs, burgers, bacon, and chili. I love being able to grab American classics on the go. Normally I would have to make these at home but Brewhouse allows the comfort of convenience with their array of veggie friendly options.

mrqUWsnebWF_WMUom9wfhg.text: We went in for food after being in the heat for hours  only to be met with long wait and a rude server who refused one of my parties ID and declared in a peer tone that it was not their identification! -WcatlkE001DhKkTffFv3w.text: For a hot dog place they sure have cheap buns. I would hope they would put more effort in the bread choices for being this type of place.  Not impressed. Staff is super nice but food is nothing to go back for. Bummer!

anpUB3jgIXeQMfxKYo8A5w.text: Food is painfully good!! The Chicago dog and the Philly cheesesteak is hands down the best In town only wish they had cots to lay on after binging food coma

5EmfS1BLwDK3J4afcxtP6w.text: I feel so silly to think I've already done a review for Great Links! I've been here so many times since they opened...I was going to update my review but it turns out, there was nothing to update! FAIL!  They have good hotdogs here. They're fresh and you could hear the snap when you bite into one. I personally like to keep it simple and get the chili dog. Very flavorful and I don't like beans so this is perfect for me. The cheese is nice and melted. But I've also tried their Mob Boss Dog which has mozzarella sticks, peppers, onions, marinara, mushrooms and parmesan cheese.  It's a great hotdog when I'm not feeling so plain.  The main reason I like this place is their Italian fries. One of my favorite fries in Vegas. Each fry is loaded with Parmesan and Italian spices. I don't like sharing mine so get your own!  I remember John Curtas raving about their burgers but I still haven't deviated from their hotdogs.  One of these days, I'll give their burger a try...with a side of Italian fries of course!

rD5wVLkrXotEGb68GP1-Xg.text: This is a great place, fantastic hot dogs, and burgers.  And many more items on the menu. The service was great, the food was excellent, and the prices were fair.  They are in a big strip mall with a Lowes, but if you weren't looking for them, like I was, you might not see that they were there.  They need a bigger sign.

fS1tfH8cd0Ke0OsjXZ6ojg.text: The people were really nice and the food was pretty good. I got a chicago dog and a cheeseburger. The chicago dog was decent, I'd order it again. I heard they won an award for their burger, so I might be in the minority here, but the burger patty reminded me of those perfect circle frozen patties you might buy at the grocery store. Not really fresh and juicy like some of the award winning burgers I've had elsewhere. My friend got a polish sausage and said it was really good.   I'll be back to try out some more of the menu and hopefully give em a higher rating after.

bq8ioWGkDj61wTR1ufKnkw.text: Best shake, burger and chili cheese fries ever. Our waitress Michelle was even better

S-JvnAAti2u4PcBJ8ANr3w.text: Previously called Famous Uncle Al's Hot Dogs & Grill  -could not change the name on the other listing so I started a new one  What I ordered:  Dr. Pepper Las Vegas Chili Dog $4.40   - white sausage sage chili, pepper jack cheese, dill relish, tomatoes, cayenne sour cream & spicy mustard   As I waited for my LV Dog, I was looking to see what kind of beer they had on tap. They have Amber Bock, Sam Adams, Bud Light, and Root Beer...wait... what? (does a double take) ROOT BEER on tap?!! I don't think I've ever seen this before. When my server brought my LV Dog out, I asked him how the Root Beer was. He brought me a small cup to try and told me they get it from Milwaukee. The root beer and my LV Dog were yummy!  I am definitely going to come going to come back and try a root beer float (made w/Breyers Ice Cream).

HdT7hT-F_-1o9gH6gthASQ.text: Great Links is a great place for a great meal.  I love the food choices, and I especially love the people that work there.  You can get a snappy dog with tons of toppings for cheap, and some killer fries, including my favorite--the Grill Master Fries (it's an acquired taste, though): fries tossed with thousand island dressing, grilled onions, then topped with melted cheese.  Ew?  Maybe.  For me?  Yum. :)  If you want a nice place to run in and eat, check them out.  And if you're brave enough, grab some grill master fries. Don't blame me if you think it's crazy and weird. I warned ya!

z3ivF8CCTCBZpbZdFCOO1Q.text: I love this place I work nearby and I try to get in there at least once or twice a month. Everything on their menu is fantastic. I absolutely love the patty melt. Syqc-kWWCwz_9MOD9Rk9DA.text: Great food and good beer.   We had the Cajun sausage dog and it was very tastey! It had shrimp on the hot dog that were cooked perfectly.  Me and the family will be returning, but could only give 4 stars as the prices arent too crazy but they are somewhat high for hotdogs.

gm3FBQ-BR01yBVoljzV5ug.text: Saw the reviews & came for lunch with the hubs.  Definitely hit the spot! We ordered the chili cheese dog, chili cheese dog deluxe, crinkle fries, & cheese stix. Sad we forgot to order the root beer on tap & just washed everything down with cherry coke. Anyways, service was great, our waitress was friendly & knowledgeable.  My 2 complaints: 1) having pre-shredded cheese is way convenient but the results you get from shredding from a cheese block, just doesn't compare. So, food for thought, buy a block of cheese & a cheese grater. 2) melt the shredded cheese before it is served. The look of waxy pre-shredded cold cheese on top of the delicious dog was slightly unappetizing.  But other than that, the dog was delicious & perfect size:)

OvFhTYFPaxzKaCsw-U391A.text: Great find in an unsuspecting location! The menu here is kind of busy so you might have to ask someone to explain all the details to you. But after Charlie broke it down for us we decided we would need to come back at least 4 times to try everything. Great in house made root beer and great deals for beers. Great plus is their ***vegan/Vegetarian*** options with tons of add on options. Family of 7 ate for just over $70 with beers sodas and other drinks and don't forget your 10% discount if you are in the military. Only thing stopping a 5 star rating is the busy menu... It was a bit overwhelming.

sqsoLZ-_0zrBsnZDDMKT6Q.text: Great place to go have a hot dog and watch the game on TV. Also the kids meal is only 4 dollars and got my hungry child full lol. Only reason why I'm giving it 4 stars is because the hot dog was a little small and I was sad. Other then that the fried pickles were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The philly dog was super cheesy and the peppers were super tender. Nice vibe and great service! 2 thumbs up

YonbSoN8G8Kt0UKdkR9kOg.text: I was taken here by my supervisor who has a habit of preferring not necessarily healthy venues but rather fast-foodish yet yummy treats which honestly left me a little apprehensive.  Our previous venture to Four Kegs was fun but left me eating salads for the remainder of the day.  What was I to expect here?  Well, the location was good - by a Starbucks I like and by Lowe's as well, so it had promise if it turned out to be a positive establishment.  Thankfully, it was.  The food was bar-style food done pretty well.  The service was pretty much kids who were on the ball.  On the four visits I've had, I've been pleased with the continual quality of service.  My drink was never low for long and my food arrived quickly and hot.    It's a simple menu and exactly what it promises: Burgers, fries, Italian sandwiches with a decent sauce, and offers a nice variety of french friends.  Their combo sauce of ketchup meets mayonnaise is pleasantly addicting and I enjoy the fact that they have a channel on the History Channel - thank you for not insulting the intelligence of your customers.    Cheap, yummy, good service.  Type you can bring your father to leaving little room for him to grumble.

dwZApAPVTXwR1jZMQn67cA.text: I never knew Boar's Head made sausages, too! Whenever I saw Boar's Head advertisements back in California, I knew the establishment served quality deli meat.  Back home, I've always yearned for a delicious dog joint akin to something like Top Dog in Berkeley. I even went so far as to consider opening one myself just so I could satiate my suffering for sausage; alas, I have found the hot dog heaven I've been looking for. I've been to this place four times in two weeks. Just straight incredibly delish dogs, fresh off the grill. Apparently their hamburgers are quite lauded, so once I go through the hot dog menu, I have another beautiful world to sink my teeth into.  The chili slaw dog and hot link have been my go to with a pint of Schrecher Draft Root Beer. I can't think of how this place can be any better.

6PNtdRdU3dCPiBzPMSZr6Q.text: Great Links is the only place I've found in Las Vegas that has both a vegetarian hot dog AND vegetarian chili, enabling me to have a veggie chili dog. Plus, the atmosphere is unique and the staff are helpful. We recently made the twenty minute drive there craving what only they offer. When we arrived, there was a sign on the door saying they were closed for a private party. We called from the parking lot, and they made our food and brought it to our car with many apologies and some free Oreos. :)

XeJk8okolA3VX7c1-o1_lQ.text: This place is great, they really listen to their customers. So many customers mentioned wanting vegan mayo, so they now have vegan mayo! I am so excited!!

N6_BkFMOj1NzQfuPCcZS5Q.text: This place is a rough gem... Think very small diner, limited menu, but oh-so comfortable. It is a drive from the Strip for visitors, as well as it should be. I'm quite sure carnivores could find other glittery gimmicky "meat in tube form" onthe Strip; however, for me, its about the vegetarian options and supporting the local economy when visiting. And, the options were enough for a couple visits or infrequent visits. For a weekend visit to Vegas, my bro and I visited twice.  With that said, vegetarian options doesn't mean healthy. Nor do they or we profess to be healthy. The meals are "stick to your ribs" good tasty meals. This is a place where the carnivores and vegetarian friends can meet, share a table and watch the game. Beer, brats, and (foot/basket/base)balls.  I can't speak for my bro meals; I had the Mob Boss (grilled peppers, onions, marinara, and two mozzarella sticks) and a simple veg chili dog. Both were very tasty, wolfed them down on each occasion. Then we also shared the Grilled Master fries (similar to In-n-Out fries, animal style), buffalo cheesy fries (I liked this, could use a little more buffalo sauce), and zucchini (crispy breaded outside with well-done juicy inside) . Sides were definitely hit the spot.  Staff were friendly and helpful, but somewhat distant/nonattentive at times. Guess it was close to the holidays and they just want to have fun, too. Understandable.  So, if you want something tasty away from the glitz, this is one place.

DDyOv_0sVBFATThHhi62HA.text: the best junk food and fast service.  cheap prices.  i love this place.  i accidentally left this in caps,too lazy to correct.  come here and pig out!

lgHEQ9ehiTL5ctQ1bQiU4g.text: Yes this is an update...1st of all incredible array of hot dog offerings..if they don't have it listed, they will make the dog for you!! Decided to go in the burger direction this time.....Probably had the best Patty melt I've ever had. It was cooked to order, medium..nicley grilled onions and your choice of cheese. I can see why they won the burger wars...they deserve it. While i was waiting was offered a free small soda..It you want a great dog or burger make this a distination stop. Staff is very help ful they will assist you in every way to make your repast good.....Enjoy

134FkHAOkAehBD8tL0gKRg.text: Every time I come here I experience great service and get great food.  The staff is awesome and I have liked everything I have ever eaten here.  Thank you Mike for the Shock Top Beer Brat, that was awesome.  This star bump was long overdue from me.

Photo of Great Links Brewhouse & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp basket

M3KyHdZ_CP20Z6VbgVhuhw.text: The family loves everything we have tried! Burgers and Tenders are great. Kids love the cheese steak and chicken sandwhiches. The favorite of the many sides have been the cottage fries. Oh, and they even have draft rootbeer!

CjNxitnH7D5L98uo2LZhcw.text: Great selection of dogs, burgers, chicken and fries.  The dill of the side menu is highly recommended.  Chili fries are a must

GNSvRy2e7KTio5hIckAwuQ.text: Wanted to try this place after seeing all of the favorable reviews here on Yelp. I was thinking a Chicago dog would be pretty awesome so I took my daughter in for lunch to give it a shot. I ordered her a kid's meal with hot dog, crinkle cut fries, and the draft root beer. (the tap handle says Death Valley Root Beer which is a phenomenal concoction but the server told me it's actually Chicago Brewing Company Root Beer they are serving, head's up on that if it matters to you) I ordered the Chi dog ala carte because I always pick at my kids' food anyway. (yah, I roll like that!)   : )   Her hot dog did not have the snap that mine did, obviously a different hot dog for the kid's versus the adult's, no big deal. I'm assuming it was the kosher dog which is on the menu and is denoted as having "no snap." That was my best Sherlock Holmes deduction.......anyway........  The crinkle cut fries were crisp, served hot, and not salted at all. Which is fine, everyone has different sodium needs so I don't think fries should come out doused in salt, it takes 2 seconds to salt to taste.   The Chicago dog was stupendous! The poppy seed roll, those little peppers, that bright green relish, a giant slab of dill pickle across the top, it was great! Her kid's hot dog, meh, it wasn't anything to write home about but edible nonetheless.  The root beer is delicious and they serve it with no ice so they know how to serve draft root beer. It is creamy, has just enough bite, and isn't overly sweet.   And just a note to one of the previous reviewer who was mentioning they "saw the chef using Boar's Head meats." WOW, you really are a Sherlock aren't you, considering they have "Boar's Head Served Here" signs at the entrance and all over the inside of the restaurant, great powers of deduction there, really that is quite impressive! LOL  I would give this place 5 stars if you could just walk up to the counter, order your hot dog, and sit down and eat it, but you must be served instead. I'll say this, the server was very polite, attentive, and personable, so that isn't the issue at all. It's just that to me, a hot dog joint should be on the cheaper and quicker side of eating and when you are being served, those attributes aren't really going to be that attainable unfortunately. I know you can make a take out order but sometimes I'd rather not eat in the car especially something as messy as a Chicago Dog.   Try it, you will like it too!   : )

Hp5wykki6gY0VxTjY1YlxQ.text: Best dogs and burgers in vegas! Their jalapeno guacamole cheeseburger kicks butt! Try the french fry variations and fried pickles! You will not want to go anywhere else! Fox five burger war champs 3 years running for good reason! Mil. Discounts also.

mmFEkZU54SaAGxhH0x6Rvg.text: Long story short, my wife and I came here after reading many great reviews and we were not impressed. The customer service was really bad and the fries were both over cooked and soggy (I didn't even know that was possible). It was not even busy and it took 10 minutes to order. We even sat down our menus and put them on the edge of the table to make it blatantly obvious. Then again, at the end of our meal it took forever for someone to bring us our bill. We came back home and wrote our original bad review, but it appears they paid to have it removed. I have now been insulted in their restaurant and on the web, thanks.

W3WFw3x0I7OZvpISiYesqA.text: It takes a lot for me to try a new place without word. But a place like this must be good if my daring order for something new was outrageously delicious. And if you must know I'm the type to always sauce up whatever I'm eating... But this time I didn't even touch the ketchup bottle. im talking about the vegas chili fries!! So, here's my word... Be daring here cus it's totally worth it.
